I had none of the negative experiences with service that many here have groused about.  Service was attentive.  Food was great.  It was loud inside, but I could still hear.

I don't get out to the Marina all that often, but I would return here in a heartbeat.
author: David W.

description:
I've been eating at this restaurant for years, but after tonight it may be my last time. 
The hostess was anything but hospitable,  she made us wait 20 minutes to be seated, even though we had a reservation and there were loads of empty seats. She never explained  why or apologized for the wait, and mostly just ignored us.
Our waitress took about a half an hour to come to our table. We were sitting at the chefs counter, normally our favorite place, and we're getting bumped every 2 minutes, mostly by the wait staff, who never once apologized. We asked if we could move to some empty seats which were unoccupied and we're told no, they were reserved, no one sat there for another 70 minutes. Our waitress than disappeared again without having taken our order. By time she finally came back she told me that the fish was out of stock and most of the other dishes were almost out, it was only 7:15, 'didnt anyone tell us' so I ordered something else. Meanwhile while I waited for my dinner and than ate my dinner, I saw no less than 6 orders of the fish they were supposedly out of go out.
That being said the food was great as always but they may need to completely restaff everywhere except the kitchen.
A thoroughly unpleasant experience.
author: Rea B.

description: It's alright... Ambiance is cool. Service is attentive and warm. But the pasta and dishes are a tad too bland for my taste. The forgot to bring our salad we order. Prob won't be back...
author: Jamie C.

description: This review is long overdue and I don't write many so this is telling how bad this experience was. I have been to A16 many times over the years and it has gotten worse every time and I don't think I will ever go back. I used to love this place but the latest experience was sub-par.  We ordered the squid ink pasta and the pasta was not cook and I don't mean it was al dente. We couldn't even finish it. We had another pasta dish and same thing. My whole party also had the same feedback. The pizza was the best part of our meal. The service was good but I couldn't get past the mediocre food.
author: Yong C.

description: Lively, warm and cosy restaurant where the food is made with care and the simplest dishes really shine thanks to little twists. The local wines are a perfect pair for the fare and I can't wait to go back for more.  We were a group of five and tried out a good portion of the menu and had a splendid time.
author: Jennifer O.

description: The waitress did not know what she was doing. The concept is great, food was good/ decent. We got the place recommended and was looking forward to the Pizza all day- it took forever to get it and then they rushed it and so the dough was raw... not an experience we thought we'd get!
author: Buriev B.

description:
Overall: good but pricey.  Great service at the door, bar and table.
Interesting cocktails and they're well made.  Nice little appetizer came with them.
The wine list is extensive but mostly Italian with very few California wines, especially by the glass.  However we had help selecting a good wine in our price range.
We had success with both the vesuvio pizza and gnocchi, but the potato-ceci was dry and flavorless.
author: First L.

description:
I think maybe I just chose the wrong thing, because I really wanted to like this place. I had seen it on my list for a while and finally decided to make a reservation and invited along a friend who loves food just as much as I do.  

We ended up getting the burrata and the calamari to start off with.  I am super duper in love with burrata right now so definitely had to order that and he wanted the squid ink calamari. Both appetizers were pretty on point flavor, texture and temperature wise. 

I ended up getting the uni pasta and my friend ordered the lamb one. My uni pasta was definitely too salty. I know that uni has this generally slightly salty flavor but this was salted to the point where it was almost inedible. Definitely not a pleasant dish for me. The pasta was definitely al dente and a good pasta. Also the dish wasn't that warm. It was lukewarm. The lamb dish was much better. The pasta was delicious and the sauce was delicious. I really had wished I ordered that instead. 

For dessert we ordered the chocolate torta which was delicious. It was supposed to have a drizzle of olive oil on top and I generally don't like olive oil on my dessert so I requested to not have it on the dessert. Overall the meal was delicious and just that little hiccup is not something I would judge a complete restaurant on. I didn't have the best experience but that doesn't mean I wouldn't give it a second chance and try something different. 

Pro tip: reservation and sit outside. It's gorgeous. Also the place is a lot bigger than how it looks from the outside.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Dining in A16 is unlike anything else. When you walk into the restaurant, you immediately see the chefs working on their amazing masterpieces, and when you look at the menu, your mouth starts to water. Had I not been dining with an A16 veteran, I would still be trying to decide what to order. Since my friend and I came for a late lunch, we decided to split the burrata and bucatini along with a carafe of chardonnay.

Burrata - fluffy and flavorful mound of cheese that is covered in olive oil and shaved salt. It comes with small crostini and melts in your mouth.

Bucatini Bottarga- noodles are a bit larger than your average spaghetti noodle (hence the bucatini), and there is a small hole in the middle. This allows for more flavor to be captured within the noodle. The bucatini is topped with a light sauce and delicious cherry tomatoes. 

A16 is on the pricier side, but you get what you pay for. The food and service are both excellent. 

I can't wait to return and try other items on the menu!
author: Emmy Q.

description: My husband and I walked by A16 on a Tuesday night and it looked really busy but we decided to go for it. The hostess had us seated within 10-15 minutes. We ordered the marinara pizza with arugula and the only vegetarian/vegan pasta on the menu to share, wine, beer, and a French press. All items were really lovely and well balanced especially the pizza which we agreed was the food highlight. What really left a positive impression on us besides our meal was the service. Our waitress was very engaging and polite despite the obviously high volume of clients at the restaurant. She picked up right away that I was vegan and she immediately recommended small adjustments to the dish to accommodate that. I know that seems like a small thing but it's a huge gesture to me and it made my experience so much more enjoyable. She also did great pacing our meal so that we never had too many dishes on the table. Overall everyone who cleaned our table or interacted with us did a great job. I absolutely recommend a visit to this place, we'll be back and hope the chef continues to incorporate more delicious vegan friendly options.
author: Monica T.

description: Definitely the best food we ate during our long weekend in SF. Service was a little slow, hence four rather than five stars. We were seated in the greenhouse at the back of the restaurant which was quiet but lacked a bit of atmosphere.  And it seemed like our server didn't want to get back there very often. I would advise anyone going here to ask for a table in the main sections. The food though was really good. One of those places where you find yourself googling the ingredients because you haven't heard of them before and now want to eat them every day. Shishito peppers with Calabrian chillis - case in point.  Our server advised us to add a fried egg to the salsiccia pizza because otherwise it would be too dry. Weird to offer something too dry but we accepted her adaptation. Trouble is, when pizza was delivered (different server), there was no egg. And she was right, it was too dry. She didn't come back to check on us but stranded back in the greenhouse we ate it anyway. Strangely though, I am now craving pizza with egg?!  Probably not as good with Dominos. The rest of the food though was excellent. Although we got there at 6pm they were already sold out of two of the four pasta dishes (come on people that's a pretty basic mistake) but the maccaronara was excellent.  The chicken polpette meatballs were very good and the roasted potato side dish was perfect.
author: Mat W.

description: Too much salt, too long of a wait for food/service, and too little care from our server.
author: Kevin W.

description: It had been a few years since I had been here for a meal, and it appears that things have really gone downhill. The starters were good. The pizza was fine. The pastas were a complete letdown. First, upwards of $25 for pasta that is not homemade is objectionable. But then the dishes arrived in embarrassingly small portions, and they were NOT well prepared. Both pastas was painfully undercooked, not al dente. And both pastas were dry and underwhelming, with scant ingredients. It is rare for me to write a review, but this meal deserved a rough review to accompany a very disappointing meal. Too many solid restaurants in this city to ever attempt a return to A16.
author: Michelle C.

description:
I was really excited to try A16 after always hearing people talk about it, but to be honest I was completely underwhelmed and don't see myself coming back anytime soon. The service was pretty good, but the food was really disappointing.

We got the:
- smoked burrata (weird texture, not like normal burrata)
- meat plate (pretty good, you can't really mess this up)
- truffle burrata pizza that was their special of the night (it was $40 and was decent, but have had way better wood fire pizza at del popolo and other places in the city)
- pasta with all of the seafood (had to send back because the noodles were extremely UNDERCOOKED, I like my pasta al dente and this was definitely undercooked) and 2 other pastas that were just meh.

Overall, for how expensive this place is, I think it is completely overpriced and unimpressive.
author: Lauren W.

description: This was our third time here. Came for my boyfriends birthday. We loved it, again. While the menu is a little sparse if you don't eat pork and are avoiding wheat (I had the root salad) my boyfriend couldn't have enjoyed his birthday meal more! Pasta, pizza, winter squash, ice cream! We sat at the back bar and thoroughly enjoyed Isaiah. He was happy to talk about the menu and his suggestions were spot on! One of the problems being a Chef and eating out is I tend to be over picky and this place continues to impress! Would like to see more poultry on the menu but was informed the chicken order hadn't come in... it happens!!
author: Carrie M.

description:
Recently celebrated my birthday at A16, based on a popular recommendations from my co-workers, I have to say they did not disappoint!  

The atmosphere: I love the ambiance here, bright, simple, contemporary style. Our seat faced the back patio with wooden decor and plants, it looked very serene.

The services: Our server was funny and knowledgeable, being the first timer, I had no idea what to get considering how small the menu is. He suggested the pizza and pasta and that was a great choice.  

The food: Let's get to the good stuff, our meal.  We ordered a margherita pizza, which in my opinion is MUCH better than Tony's pizza on North Beach.  The crust and flavor was perfect.  We also had the squid ink pasta with uni.  Don't let the black pasta look fooled you, the pasta was spicy, delish and the uni added the perfect touch to the flavor.  We finished off our dinner with the peach crostada, which is pretty much a peach cobbler.  The highlight of my dessert was a birthday candle.

Overall, I love this place and cannot wait to come back to try more of their delicious dishes.  Make sure to have reservations because the place filled up quick!
author: Katie N.

description: Good food but the service is terrible, from the front to the back. So many mix ups and very slow.  It's a loud place.  If you go, sit at the counter, the other tables are jammed together and the high tops lack atmosphere.  You don't get the sense that the staff is happy and it's too packed/busy.  But the pizza and burrata were great.  Don't bother with dessert.  Wine pours are not generous.
author: monica p.

description:
The food is very good. 
Especially the pizza. 
The service is extremely slow because the restaurant is understaffed. Not unusual. 
The owners are squeezing the lemon. 
May be the waiters don't want to share tips. 
Anyway only go there if you have plenty of time ahead of you.
author: JJ B.

description: We can't thank Helen and the staff at A16 enough for the most perfect evening! My fiancé hosted our families in the private room for a surprise engagement dinner. Delicious food, impeccable service, and great wines! Highly recommend the burrata, pizza, and homemade pastas! Helen even ran to get a fan at Walgreens to keep us cool during the record breaking SF heat wave! Thank you A16 for being a part of our special day and making it unforgettable! If you are looking for a place to host a perfect group dinner in SF- look no further than A16!
author: Briana C.

description:
This place has gone downhill. Five years ago, the food, ambiance and service were excellent.  My husband and I were here for dinner on a Friday night recently and sat at the kitchen bar.  We ordered a margarita pizza, pork chop, and a pasta dish.  The pizza and pasta were not memorable at all (both are better at Delarosa down the street), but the pork chop was just offensive.  

First of all, it came about 30 minutes after the pizza and pasta were finished, and we watched it being made in the oven. When it finally arrived, we sliced it and it was raw inside. Not pink and slightly underdone- completely raw and transparent. Like sashimi. Gross. We politely pointed it out to the server who agreed it was raw meat, and took it back. We saw the "chef" place it back in the oven for a bit of searing and it was brought back. She offered no apologies. Again, raw. I'm a huge fan of pork chop so I know what I'm seeing but we were told it was supposed to be pink.  It was totally inedible.  On top of that, most of it was fat.  What a waste of money.   It was also really loud and dark, to the point of it being uncomfortable.  Even with most of the raw pork chop still on the plate, we were offered no alternatives nor were we comped for inedible food.  Again, this place used to be great but now it's just shameful.
author: Kari L.

description:
Good roast calamari, steak, and reasonably priced cocktails.  But pizza was soggy, w rubbery "crust".  

And ordering our bottle of Red required three people and more than 20 minutes.  The guy in the tie came first, after we'd described to him what we wanted in a red, and specified a price range.  He brought a wine to taste, which he admitted was outside the price range we specified.  When we asked him how much, he didn't know and beat a hasty retreat, saying he'd be right back, NEVER to reappear.  Our waitroid did appear, some minutes later, helping us navigate the 15-page mainly southern Italy wine list to settle on a bottle of our choice.  The sommelier then appeared some minutes later, with yet a third selection, not the one we'd ordered, but only a few dollars more.  Unfortunately, by then quite parched, we took it.  Later when we discussed the matter with our waitroid, telling her that in effect we'd ordered scrambled eggs and had been served an omelette (because that was what they thought we'd really wanted), she walked away from us shaking her head, perplexed.  Rude service, scamming for every extra buck.  I WILL NEVER GO BACK!
author: bill c.

description:
Come back to this place to find it's still excellent and churning out slightly charred Napolitano style pizzas, delicious handmade pastas and thoughtful salads (I had the Squash Salad). If it weren't in the marina I would be here more often -- great wine list with every region of Italy well represented. 

The service was informative and attentive without being cloying. This is a great place to have high end Italian food -- thanks for keeping it real for so long A16.
author: Anthony V.

description: U can prolly go to Italy and back and get fed sooner than u would at this place. A good ambiance, which is good since you'll have plenty of time to assess the inventory while u wait to get fed.
author: J V.

description:
A16 San Francisco is hands down one of my favorite Italian restaurants in San Francisco. I first experienced A16 when I was still living in New York City and was visiting San Francisco on business. I had heard from a local friend it was a must try so I went in by myself and LOVED IT! I met Benito, one of the bartenders who has since become a good friend. Our friendship started during my first visit as I was dining by myself inquiring about the wines. He lead a small wine tasting and the rest was history!! He has since taken fabulous care of me and really makes each visit very special, delicious and always a LOT of fun!!  Typically the moment I walk in the door and he spots me I have persecco in my hands within a minute or two. We then progress to wine bases on my mood and what I'm ordering. My kind of experience, right? 

As a local to San Francisco, I can now call A16 one of my regular spots I love to frequent. I usually go with a girlfriend for a drink which eventually leads to a bite or two at the bar. There's not much better than amazing, flavorful food, an awesome lively ambiance, great service and a spot that feels like home. A few of my favorites include: The Burrata Appetizer, Mozzarella Pizza, Maccaronara Pasta, and the Chocolate Budino Tart Dessert with Sea Salt. No matter what you order, you have to save room for dessert!

Recently, I had the pleasure of meeting their owner and Wine Director Shelley Lindgren. She was beyond friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their Italian Wines leading me and a friend through a delicious Italian Wine Flight. I really felt like a lucky girl! To not only meet the owner of one of my favorite local restaurants, but to hear her expertise first hand in an intimate setting was beyond special. Whether Shelley, Benito, Alex or Steve are covering the bar I know I'm in great hands and will have an amazing experience! For those in the East Bay they also have a location in Oakland that I also adore, A16 Rockridge.

Thanks for checking out my post I hope you enjoy dining with The JetSetting Fashionista. Emily
author: JetSettingFashionista J.

description:
We had great service and great pizza! This is one of the best in SF.

The high seats in the bar area for two were perfect, away from the more noisy rear dining area.

Our server was one of the best ever!

What a great experience!
author: Richard T.

description: These people are so pretentious. They make no effort to rectify poor communications on their end.  Instead of the customer is always right they feel they are always right.  Must be nice to feel that you are above everyone.
author: Janet D.

description: What's not to like?  Neapolitan pizza, fresh ingredients and a lovely wine list- the perfect spot for a leisurely Saturday lunch. We ordered to share and it was the best way to go. Farra salad with mint pesto, little gem salad, green beans with tarragon, to start. Margherita pizza, salsiccia, and a mushroom blend were plenty for our group of 6. Pair that with a bottle of Rosé and you're all set. I'd definitely return to A-16.
author: Isabella J.

description: Had the 3 course menu there today for lunch with my wife.  $26.00 per.  3 super skimpy luke-warm meatballs and small portion of pasta. First and last time there.
author: Robert B.

description:
This review is from the 4 of us that went to dinner at A16 last night. The service was TERRIBLE! It was a Monday, I get it, you're busy.. well then bring in someone else to help! We waited about 15 minutes before the guy even asked us if we wanted a drink.. When he finally came for our drink order, we decided to just place our entire order in fear that he would never come back. 

The Burrata app was MEH... How can you get burrata wrong? Well the presentation was lousy - just slapped some bread on a place and dropped the buratta on the side - but it wasn't that rich, delicious, silky taste - it was kind of dry.. ehhh

We ordered the Steak - medium rare please!! It came back RAW! We sent it back - came back RAW again - so raw it was hard to cut into it. 

The chicken was salty.. 

Seriously people, how is this place even full on a Monday.. It's terrible all around.. OH and the back room is sooo damn HOT! I will never, ever, everrrrr come back!
author: Monica S.

description:
So good!! This is my go-to italian place in the Marina. When making your reservation, note and ask for the Chefs Table at least once, its really fun to watch the pizza people. 

The waiters are really nice and the food is the best. I've gotten the Margarita pizza multiple times and its always a hit, thin crust, fresh cheese and delicious. 

The burrata is an obvious appetizer you have to order, its so fresh and the olive oil is amazing. The octopus appetizer is also really good, that was probably my favorite of the appetizers, they give you a pretty fair portion size and its dressed nicely.
author: Molly S.

description: A16 never disappoints when it comes to the quality of food. I love pasta and they don't have your typical dishes. I love trying new things and different flavors and textures. I would love the staff to be a little friendlier at times.
author: Vanessa C.

description: We had beet salad, eggplant antipasto, saffron noodles, beef meatballs, chocolate tart, and fruit pastry.  Everything was delicious.
author: The W.

description:
It's too crowded. That's why nobody goes there anymore. Seriously, this is a good--maybe even great--Italian restaurant that uses fresh ingredients, maintains an interesting wine list that doesn't ignore California and has a knowledgable service staff. A dinner with a carafe of wine, a pizza, and about 6 small plates came to about $150 including tax and tip. Not bad for the area and quality of food.
So what didn't I like? Well, the crowds. The folks I was meeting were late and they don't seat incomplete parties. (Fair enough, I suppose.) We ended up at the bar in the midst of the noising dining room. Watching the kitchen was fun but not the best for conversation. The simple press of people and service staff also meant that pacing of our food could have been better. (Not the servers' fault.) I'd come back but might look to eat at an off-time. Worth trying.
author: Eli L.

description:
It was the worst meal that I can remember anywhere. One star was being generous. I have eaten meals at this restaurant for over 20 years. In the last couple of years the menu has changed and not for the better. It has become an expensive pizza restaurant.  We sat at the bar and watched them make the pizzas.  They put as little ingredients as possible.  

We started the meal with the ham and salami platter.  It was very small and the ham was American. Not Italian or Spanish.  It was the starting point on what was a terrible meal with them using the cheapest and least amount of ingredients.  We next went to the main course.  The calamari pasta and the special pasta that has been the mainstay for a long time. The calamari special was special. No calamari. The special pasta had the minimum red sauce that was possible and was thick and edible.
author: Richard B.

description: Whenever I go to Off the Grid at Fort Mason, A16 is the first food truck I go to. I believe that it's some of the best pizza in the city, so it's a little sad to see that it only has three and half starts. I order the Margherita every time and it never disappoints. They hand the pizza to you immediately after it's been in the oven, so it's nice and warm. The bread is soft, chewy, and it's the perfect amount for one to two people depending on if you want to go to other food trucks or not. They have a limited menu at Off the Grid, but that's okay as long as the Margherita stays on it. A16 is now something I crave every week.
author: Radhika G.

description:
This would be a five-star review if there weren't issues with my reservation, otherwise it was a flawless experience. I attempted to book a reservation for my birthday dinner for myself and nine girlfriends at multiple different places in SF. Surprisingly, I called nearly ten different places for a 7:30pm appointment for ten guests, on a Thursday and had no luck. I was told A16 could not accommodate my request when I called the restaurant. Because I was set on making my reservation here, I also e-mailed the restaurant requesting an appointment if there were any cancellations. I was contacted by the manager directly asking if there were any other times that would suffice. I gave her a couple alternate time options and she was able to secure my ten-guest spot. I was stoked!

When a couple guests in my party arrived before I did, the hostess was able to locate my reservation but only for a party of six. When they showed concern and questioned the party size, the hostess argued with them, assuring them their reservation was listed correctly. When I arrived, I was able to pull up the e-mail slew, and all was solved. 

We were squeezed into a table that was clearly not reserved for our party, which was kind of awkward and inconvenient, but we made it work. We decided on two appetizers, the charcuterie plate and burrata plate. Both were absolutely delicious. For dinner we ordered nearly four or five pizzas that are delivered with scissors to hand-cut, a pasta, salad, etc. Everything was absolutely scrumptious. 

As for the wine, uhhhhh where to start? The most intricate, endless list of wines I've ever seen. We had the waiter pick out two bottles, one red, one white. Their knowledge is to the T. I was beyond happy with both selections. 

Overall, this place was exceptional.
author: Saralina B.

description: A16 came highly recommended from a friend of mine and did not disappoint! Great service, perfect atmosphere and deliciously flavorful food. We started off with the Burrata and Tagliere Di Salumi -- both delicious and paired nicely together. The pizza at A16 is every bit as good as people say it is-- maybe even better. We devoured the Cavolo pizza and added prosciutto and chili oil. UNREAL! Not something I would typically order, but we trusted the expertise of our waiter and are so glad we did! As I looked around the restaurant, everything on every single table looked delicious, so I really do not think you can go wrong here. Highly recommend!
author: Michelle P.

description:
I didn't think Flour and Water "Pizza" could be out done. . .  until now!  I'm a Pizza Snob and A16 has earned my #1 spot for wood fired pizza perfection.  
The pasta was good however not extraordinary. The  cobbler desert was fantastic. I will return for the best Pizza thus far of my life . . . Well done A16! To be constructive the table wait staff was a little slow and after waiting for 20 mins I had to track him down for our ticket. Service should match the food . . . The bar staff however was upbeat, fun, with a high since of urgency. He made our hour wait enjoyable . . .We Sampled wine and enjoyed apps with guided input by the bartender and sat down at our table well versed on what we should order. His recommendations didn't disappoint.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I'm really torn between a 4 and 3 star review and finally settled on this. We were able to get a last minute reservation for a Thursday night at 7pm, which I would have thought to almost be impossible. The service was great, but the lighting was so dim that a table behind us had to take out their iPhones and use the flashlight on it to read the menu. To say the least, this was beyond annoying because the light kept on flashing us. 

They don't serve hard liquor, only wine and beer. We ordered the burrata as the starter, which was nice and salty. I had the trout with the fava beans, which were a great balance to the flavor of the fish. Meanwhile the hubby had the maccaronara ragu, which he also highly enjoyed. 

If the atmosphere were to be a little more inviting, then I would come back here again. Parking can be a bit of a hassle, especially on weekends, but either way I still think people should come and try this place for their own opinion.
author: Carolina S.

description: This restaurant is so yummy. The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly and the burrata was to die. Will definitely be going back for seconds... and thirds... and so on.
author: Christy C.

description: We got a couple of their margherita pizzas at Off the Grid Fort Mason last night. Just about my ideal margherita, but it's a bit heavy-handed on the sodium (I think?) in the sauce and overpriced. Almost $15 for a personal-sized pizza. And they have the nerve to charge for the box. Kind of tacky.
author: Paulina F.

description:
COST: $77 a person (incl tax/tip).

SERVICE: Our server was sweet, but she would ask how things were, & before we even got to answer she would say, "Great! Good to hear!" She was probably exhausted. Otherwise things ran very smoothly. 

MUST-HAVES: Braised octopus! Crispy pork belly starter, Sweet Corn side.

STARTERS:
* Burrata - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#VUROoK8Oto6wQBUlPkcQ2w
(olive oil, sea salt & crostini. $12) 
Good but not as much wow factor as before, not quite worth $12. Crostini: overtoasted/too crunchy. Burrata needed more seasoning/kick but had a great soft, stretchy texture. Olive oil added subtle flavoring.

* Crispy pork belly - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#o74x34KY7aC7mHwfvIr1Hw
(pearl barley, spigariello, calabrian chiles, salsa verde. $15)
Fantastic crispy layer over a tender chunk of meat. Barley: great texture but a little dry. Spigariello: amazing light bitter taste & slight char, added a different angle to the overall flavor.

* Braised octopus - 5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#sn5dXjhUPUGIQ8T68jf38g
(cubanelle peppers, roasted fingerling potatoes, black olives, purslane. $16)
Everyone's fave! I've never had octopus so incredibly tender. None of that chewiness that comes with calamari. Not much else stood out, though the potatoes were well roasted.

~~PIZZA~~
* Funghi - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#B3G2pot2Oe-PIx-HzYP5Sw
(mushrooms, smoked mozzarella, grana padano, dandelion greens, garlic, oregano, olive oil. $19)
Nicely done, but I personally like pizza w/ tomato sauce. This was much heavier on savory/mushroom flavors. I thought the mushrooms were a little chewy; I prefer it to be softer as a topping.

~~PASTA~~
* Maccaronara - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#uzIelyn6l53wIlFYD-KYyg
(ragu napoletana, house-made ricotta salata. $11/$19)
I like the thick noodles, but too al dente for me. I didn't get to eat this right when it came out so maybe it wasn't quite fresh/warm. The sauce seemed light, less flavorful than before. Good but no wow factor.

* Ricotta gnocchi - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#m6eSZQehONMOb_CvSksTRQ
(devil's gulch rabbit sugo, cherry tomatoes, fennel, dandelion greens, grana padano. $13/$21)
In general I've realized ricotta gnocchi isn't for me: it's softer & comes apart more easily than regular gnocchi, which is more solid/chewy. That being said, out of the ricotta gnocchis I have had this is the best & comes closest to the texture of regular gnocchi. It still has that airy texture, though. The ragu was good but there was so little of it - just one pile in the corner, & same w/ the greens!

~~ENTREES~~
* Lucky dog ranch sirloin steak - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#sjqPPp6qXM8vQIidTGL0Cw
(cipolinis, scarlett turnips, baby carrots. $26)
The meat: very tender, well done. The outside could use a bit of char. Each piece was pretty homogeneous in texture w/ a little pink in the middle. This was like modern & small-portioned American comfort food - no pop in flavor, but good quality & well cooked.

* Berkshire pork chop - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#Ra0ZrvRF3_5dl0a8w0MK5Q
(roasted peach mostarda, toasted hazelnuts, wild arugula. $28)
Tried a bite - really liked it, like the unique peach flavor.

~~SIDES~~
* Sweet corn - 4.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#Ia4KQuoZgTDZNxY_c6dweg
(black pepper, olive oil. $7)
Simple yet amazing! Love the char, & it's super sweet & juicy w/ a kick from the pepper.

* Mixed baby lettuces - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#YqFSbdQk9fd6hAfLNGr4_g
(radish, lemon vinaigrette. $7)
Nothing special, couldn't even taste the vinaigrette.

~~DESSERT~~
Dessert menu: 
* Pistachio panna cotta w/ Dirty Girl strawberries ($9) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#OAxwCtHdTBr1dNFxDx28kQ
I like the slight pistachio flavor. Strawberries: fresh! Texture: a little too gelatin-like & jiggly, definitely could be softer. Crackers were like Pirouettes, added good texture, they snap yet are soft.

* Blueberry bread pudding w/ vanilla gelato & Dry Creek peaches ($9) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/a-16-san-francisco?select=waK92Cv-AvuV8dfxcfdRCg#pH21fTOpInbkM4HSLqY5iw
Texture: more solid than soft, not my style. Blueberries were sweet - I wish it were more tart to contrast the sweetness of the rest of the dessert. The peaches provide that a little. Ice cream: fantastic!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Napolitana.
Food highway to Campania.
Lindgren for the win(e).
author: Nish N.

description:
Nice Italian - $$$

Best Dishes:
-Burrata
-Margarita pizza + add prosciutto

Best For: nice lunch/dinner, parent dinner, date, girls dinner

A16 is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city. Perfect place to have a nice dinner with some really good pasta/pizza without having to make a reservation 4 weeks in advance. First off I have to say everything here from the food to the ambiance is amazing. There is a lot on the menu aside from pizzas, so it's a great place to go if you don't want just pizza. I would 100% recommend making a reservation, but you can also just walk in and try and snag a spot at the bar, or get there on the early/late side of dinner and the wait shouldn't be too lon
author: Kelli L.

description: One of the best place to hang out in SF , best pizza great atmosphere amazing wine list from south of Italy , and the Monday night meatballs are excellent .
author: Cris V.

description:
I had heard great things about this place, but I was disappointed with my visit.
My wife & I started out with the smoked burrata appetizer and it was great. Our wine, suggestions from the bartenders, were good. But our entrees were incredibly mediocre. We both had pasta dishes. Mine was undercooked. I appreciate an al dente pasta, but this was undercooked! 
Overall my expectations were much higher than my actual experience. I paid $150 for a meal that was...meh.
author: KV V.

description: In love with this place and their amazing food and service!! Worth the hour wait for sure. We had the squid ink pasta and it was phenomenal. The wine is also very good and everything on the menu is worth the price. Coming back!
author: Evelyn A.

description: I love this hip and trendy restaurant in San Francisco's Marina District.  This was my second time dining here and it was as fabulous in service and quality as I remembered it when there in 2013.  We started with a luscious burrata with crostini, followed by hearty white beans then a creamy bucatini.  We split the roasted chicken entree that was beautifully presented, unbelievably moist and so tasty.  Just 1 disappointment was their incredibly delicious sweet corn side dish was discontinued on the menu.  Fancy pizzas are also offered and popular with customers.  Their wine list is extensive and mostly Italian so we chose a Primitivo.  A16 attracts an attractive crowd from those out for a casual night to sharp suits walking in after work.  I highly recommend dining here when in San Francisco but remember to secure a reservation since this place is popular and gets packed quickly.
author: Kelly P.

description:
SO disappointing!!!  This place rides on it's coattails of having a great wine list...BUT the food doesn't even come close as a match to their wine list.  Shame on Shelley L.  She should definitely pay more attention to food prep.  First I ordered a pasta dish and it was so chewy---almost like chewing gum and way under-cooked I couldn't take but the first bite and had to return it.  My waiter was very nice and suggested I try a pizza...same thing!!!  So undercooked and chewy that I couldn't imagine anyone enjoying such a dish.  Dough was not cooked and impossible to cut (with shears), let along chew.  I had no choice but to return this as well and felt bad...not just for having to do this twice, but because this restaurant was such a huge disappointment.  Maybe Shelley should concentrate more on her chefs, cooking, food, rather than her exemplary wine list and not open more restaurants (Oakland, etc.) until she's got it down right in her first place.
I'm a food critic and sorry but no way I would recommend this to anyone...and it was not this bad on my previous visit.
author: Louise S.

description:
I don't really see the appeal in this place. All aspects of our dining experience were awful.

Our server was inattentive and unhelpful. My girlfriend is sensitive to gluten. When we finally flagged the server down and asked the server to point out the items on the list that are GF, he repeatedly told us, "the menu is straightforward" and "it is very simple."... Besides the fact that we were asking him a question and he never answered it, the menu is written in mostly Italian (i.e. a foreign language!). Even though my girlfriend had taken quite a few Italian classes in college, we still could not wholly decipher the menu, and this guy's idea of helping was to insist that it is simple enough for us to figure out on our own..

They have no beer on tap and an extremely poor selection of bottled/canned beers... Furthermore, he took our $7 canned beer (yea, out of a can for 7 bucks...), cracked it open and sloshed it in to the cup creating a foamy mess all over.

On top of overpriced pizza, they nickle and dime you for additional toppings (since when do I have to pay extra to have my pizza come with cheese on it? And if that was the case, wouldn't you explain that what your "simple" menu means by pizza is actually just bread with some sauce on it??) 

The pizza comes uncut with a pair of scissors. This was new to me and came off as gimmicky to our whole party.

Of the two pizzas we ordered, we finished neither due to the bland flavor. We asked the bus boy for a box so we could take it home to the dog. He then grabbed our plates as if to clear the table. We stopped him to remind him that we JUST said we would like a box. He looked me in the eye and said no problem and cleared the plates. That was the last I ever saw the pizza. We waited about 10 minutes for the waiter or busboy to come by to ask what was up but they never came by. At this point we had already paid, decided to cut our losses and took off. 

As we left, we walked right by the manager and host who were too caught up in their conversation and their phones to respond to my "goodnight" or help the 2 parties that were standing right in front of them waiting to be seated..

I often avoid dining in the marina as I usually find the food/experience is no where near worth the cost of its trendy restaurants. This experience has only reinforced this opinion

TLDR:

Too expensive, lacking flavor, small portions, staff is no good and the menu is weak. We will not be returning.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Overpriced and food is nothing special. Bland flavors. Service nothing special either. Waters went unfilled and such.
author: Silver T.

description:
Love this place for a fun scene that still feels local, and very well-crafted Italian food. It's a long place that has several areas: the cozy bar (typically jammed at peak hours), a no man's land on the other side of the bathroom door dividing wall, the rear dining area, and the covered min-patio outside. There's also a nice long counter, where you can watch the chef's do their thing. Love this option, but it can get a bit hot if you're too close to the wood burning pizza oven.

Speaking of the pizza, it is is very good, but the other dishes deserve even more merit. I had the roast chicken the other night, with a super good burrata to start. Their pasta dishes are on point, and the mostly Italian wine list is worth exploring. It's the kind of place that can take something as simple as cannellini beans or corn, send them to the pizza oven, and elevate them to a much higher level. Granted, it can get packed. But once you're in, you feel like you've found something very cool. Trust me, you'll go back.
author: Tom M.

description:
It bums me out to write this review but I think it must be done. We had dinner with friends at A16 last night after talking the place up to them, having had a fantastic experience twice in the past. We were seated promptly upon arrival at our reserved time. They were clearly short-staffed last night, which is not the server's fault, however it made for a less than pleasant experience that was not cheap. We are familiar with the cost of dinner at A16, so were expecting to treat ourselves. We waited at least 45 minutes before the server was able to return to take orders for food. I felt badly for the server, as she was so hurried and clearly not in a good mood. We then asked for a decanter for the wine, which of course took awhile. The server was so hurried that she brought the decanter and instantly started topping our glasses off right away even though we wanted to allow the wine to open up a bit. 

The food was tasty, everyone liked their meals and we enjoyed the burrata appetizer. But the service really soured our evening. I felt embarrassed having selected the restaurant for our special night out with friends. By the time the dessert menus were tossed in front of us, no one was really in the mood to spend more money after feeling like the staff was miserable. 

This is not intended to scold the waitstaff - as it is awful to be short staffed - although it wouldn't have hurt to have given us a warm/sincere apology or explanation. We may also have been more understanding if a manager perhaps had come around to apologize, or even if they had dropped off a complimentary few olives or biscotti as a gesture. 

Unfortunately, we had been looking forward to this dinner for a few weeks and I know that our friends are unlikely to return, given the experience. I am not sure that we will return either, as it seems A16 is simply riding on their reputation.
author: Anne Y.

description: Great ambience - draws a good crowd every night! Staff friendly and prompt with service. Food delicious - especially the pork chop! Great experience overall... clear why it was been a SF staple for so many years.
author: Sarah H.

description:
We had a small wedding recpetion there, my friends said the food was really good, the place was really nice and clean, they did print a nice menu for us, but I think it was  overpriced, the person in charge left early making the payment a little bit confusing!

Nice place and food but definitely they can improve the service and the prices.
author: Cynthia V.

description: Took friends from out of town, as we love this local place. Service was horrible! Ordered bottle of wine ($70) which they didn't serve us for almost 30 mins. The sommelier brought a different bottle as they didn't have what we ordered. Would have been nice if the waiter came and explained what was going on - but no sign of him until the end of the meal. Our appetizers took 40 minutes (burrata and carpaccio). Had to ask another server for more water. Had to ask the sommelier where our dinner was. The people next to us had drinks and dinner before ours ever came. We only ordered - a pizza and a half portion of pasta. San Francisco has plenty of good restaurants. No need to go back here.
author: K R.

description:
This place is always busy everytime i pass by. I just had to give them a try.  We tried to make reservations on the day of, but the hostess said there weren't any openings but we can still give it a try when we arrive.  When we really did arrive she was so gracious and helpful. we were able to get a table within 20 mins.  

Since i wasn't too hungry , my friend and i just shared a pizza.  I ordered the Funghi which was mushrooms, smoked mozzarella, grana padano, dandelion greens,
garlic, oregano, with olive oil.  For 4.00 extra we got  Prosciutto and an egg ($2.00 extra) We also got a side of corn just to see how that's like on a pizza.  Overall the pizza was ok.  It was too burnt for my liking, but i guess that's how overbrick pizzas are made.  I'm giving them 4 stars mainly because of the service.  Everyone from the hostess to the waitress where all super nice. Sometimes i feel when you are eating in a restaurant that's dimly lit, it's easy for them to forget about you. but that's not the case here.  it's the service that sometimes makes it worth coming back.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Really awful service man... 

Also they serve old bread baskets which is cool. Server was embarrassed when we asked them to take it back. 

Pizza was alright, cauliflower was cold, Italian soda (not made by them) was the highlight.
author: Sara V.

description: When I first looked at A16 it looked like a nice hip Italian restaurant. It is usually packed and a reservation is needed when attending dinner. Upon my entrance we got a lousy hostress's attention and asked to be seated. She didn't even know if tables where open. She went and checked and told us to wait 15-20 minutes. After waiting we final got a table even though about 7 where open. Our waiter gave us funky water that tasted like really really old sparkling water. We asked a bus boy for new water and he forgot to bring it. We asked a different waiter and a long time later they brought it. The pizza was extremely over priced at $27. After my food arrived they made me cut it with some skimpy scissors. My pizza was very bland. No flavor what so ever. Never coming back to this terrible establishment. Don't waste your time here. Do better things.
author: Cole F.

description:
Great dinner last night! Came with my cousins around 945 pm, the weather was just right and Chestnut was packed! Anyway, Emily was our waitress and she did an amazing job refilling and getting out orders down. Food came on time; it gave us the time to talk and socialize before eating. The setting here is everything! Dim lights, people talking and enjoying! The cooks working the kitchen, and outdoor patio full of fancy people, etc. Great atmosphere here! 

Their pizza is on point with that over rustic taste and fresh veggies on top! They're not stingy with their cured anchovies either, they give you a whole bowl full. Their pork chop with the sweet apricots is a must! Tender near like steak with a crust! Mmm! 

Overall, I love A16! I want to def come back and try more! Thanks Emily!
author: Allister D.

description:
This is our favorite Italian spot in the neighborhood.... The standard meal for sharing with the fiancé  = Burrata, Bianca pizza with pancetta & egg (thank you waitstaff for that pizza tip) and the Maccaronara. We've tried several specials and enjoy other dishes, but always go back to the aforementioned order.

The wine list is extraordinary. The space and vibe on a good night remind me of being back in NYC...which is always a welcome feeling. Thank you, A16!
author: Jen P.

description: Marinated Olives + Burrata +  Maccaronara = SO GOOD!!
author: Nicole D.

description:
A16 was recommended by several acquaintances and turned out to simply underperform. 
I was born and raised in the southern part of Italy, whose cuisine the restaurant is inspired by (as far as I understood). 
Food was decent (nothing special)  and the quality/price ratio was not exactly satisfying. 

On a positive note, ambiance and service were good. Hence the three stars. 

All in all, because the quality of the food is what matters most in this industry, there are  a lot of better Italian restaurants in the city. I don't think I will ever go back if it was to be my pick.
author: Mr. Food G.

description: Ate at the bar while staying in town. Ate the macarronara, their signature pasta, and the chocolate budino (a MUST). Trust the bartenders to pour you some wine based on your tastes. They gave free tastings to make sure I liked it. Amazing service and one of the best meals I've ever had.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
Food is great! Wait Service is spectacular. Great fun. Great food.  Amazing wine and people who know their wine!  tell 'em what you like even if you have no idea what you are talking about they pick one thats perfect!

The hostess is gorgeous.....and totally rude and incompetent.  I will go back again and again because the food and service is that good. But the hostess is beyond rude. When I suggested to her that she has a bad attitude she responds "would you like to talk about it?". Our response is "no, we'd like an apology".  Her response "are you ok?"   seriously.  I say again "how about an apology for being so rude".  Her response "lets talk about it".  Woman, get a job as a model.  You are beautiful. But dealing with people and being the front person at a great restaurant is not your calling.

That said, management was amazing. Told them the who story and they were gracious, apologetic (sincerely) and didnt attempt to defend the stupid behavior of this hostess. Thank you manager. You are the best.

Finally, not the first time with this rude hostess so it wasnt just a bad day. A16, get rid of the pretty hostess and you get 5 stars.  Or keep her and we keep coming back anyway and never make eye contact with her if we can help it!
author: Robert H.

description: I had specials, butternut squash salad with radicchio, cashews and ricotta salata. I paired that with a glass of Etna Rosso. It was divine. I stayed on theme with a squash pizza. Seriously can't say I have ever had better. The service was was very good. The look of the place is a nice combo of modern and traditional. I finished with an espresso. It's expensive, so i won't go often, but i will def go back.
author: Steven K.

description:
The food is great here! I ordered the Bruschetta, which had mushrooms and a fried egg on it. It was hefty, but delicious. 

I also ordered the Squid Ink Pasta with Uni and Crab. I love Squid Ink and Uni, so I swear that dish was made for me!

Our waitress was very attentive and helpful, although the hostesses were slightly rude.
author: Monica H.

description:
I've lived in San Francisco on and off for 8 years and A16 has been my favorite place for the last 6-ish. I've been here at least a dozen times and have never had a reason to rate below 5 stars, so its 3.5 star rating (as of January 2017) seriously surprises me. I may have waited a bit past my reservation time once or twice, because this happens to popular restaurants, but never a serious gaffe or miss on the food.

A16 offers delicious, soulful Italian food and a fantastic wine list. It is not cheap, but is well priced for its quality and great for sharing in couples or groups. The burrata appetizer and the pizzas are my staples (guests cut their own the pizza with pizza scissors, which is just fun). The pizza crust is thin enough to allow the toppings to shine, but also substantial. Pastas are super solid as well. I've never had reason to order the mains!

The wine list might be a thick black binder, but the somms are far from pretentious - and they are super knowledgeable. I highly recommend leaning on them, regardless of whether you are going BTG or bottle, and regardless of how much you know about wine (they will still work magic with just a color and a price range). You're guaranteed a great discovery. 

A16's atmosphere is chic but doesn't try too hard. Its consistent busy-ness speaks for its quality, but the space is large enough that off-peak weekend reservations are often available the week of.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: The pizza was great but our service was terrible. We were seated then ignored for a long time. Even after being promised by the hostess and a manager that someone would wait on us it took many more minutes. Good food but our service was unacceptable.
author: John E.

description:
I've been meaning to check this place out and fortunately the sis chose this place in one of our dinner outings. 

It was packed... as I imagined... but we managed to get seated quite promptly. 

I don't remember what the group ordered but here's what I got:  
- Marinated olives = good variety ... went well with our wine
- Burrata with olive oil, sea salt and crostini = loved this... it was the perfect blend of creamy and tasty!
- Pumpkin gnocchi with chanterelles, squash brodo, garlic, rosemary, olio nuovo and grana padano = AWESOME gnocchi! This really surprised me... I didn't think it was going to be that tasty and oh so good but it was. Perfectly made... seasoned... I highly recommend! 

We ordered dessert but I don't remember what they were... 

Overall... glad I was able to check this off my list... good, simple food that taste good and prices were reasonable. Friendly staff... though the place itself was loud so you might need to raise your voices here and there to be heard.
author: Cath M.

description: I don't think 5 stars even covers the amazing dining experience we had at A16.  The wine, appetizers, dinner, cappuccino and delicious after dinner drinks were all PERFECT!  An absolutely beautiful way to end a holiday weekend.  Darren K was a huge contribution to our GREAT meal at A16 because your suggestions and calm attitude were so welcoming.  We had such an extremely lovely evening - Thank You Darren K.  You have without a doubt restored our genuine dining experience at A16. It was BEYOND...
author: Anjali K.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the menu options and was further impressed when most of their food turned out to be good. 

Their Margherita pizza is on par with many of the greats we have here in the city. They offer a chili oil for added heat. The hubs mentioned his steak was just simply "okay" I personally come here for the pizzas and every once in awhile their pastas are equally great. 

Unless you don't mind waiting around be sure to check for reservation availability timeslots before casually dropping by. This place can get quite busy!
author: Esther A.

description:
I'm sorry but A16 is way overrated. Was really excited to celebrate a birthday dinner here but was met with holier than thou attitude and overly hyped food. 

A few hours before our reservation, we called and asked if it would be possible to come half an hour later than our original reservation. The person on the phone didn't even acknowledge my question and left me on the line wondering if anyone was still there or actually looking into my question. About 5 minutes later, a new voice comes on the line and says "no, you can either come at 6 or come at 7:30." Well damn guys, you must be really busy on a Sunday night at 6! 

So we arrive at 6 and of course there are TONS of tables open. For some reason, they seat us at the bar in the back that is literally in the eye of the pizza oven as if they were trying to cook us instead of the pizza. It was BOILING. Not to mention, not exactly the vibe we were going for for our birthday dinner - which I had specified when I made the reservation. Thankfully they agreed to reseat us and about 10 minutes later we got our new table.

Service, while friendly, was very slow and a hostess had to take care of taking our orders and bringing us water as our waitress couldn't.

While the food is good - I love the burrata (but come on, it's cheese) and their pasta noodles are divine, it's so not worth the snooty attitude at the door and the "oh we're so packed and sexy" vibe of the place. It's clear they place more value on maintaining that Manhattan-ish vibe than actually caring for their customers.
author: Rachel L.

description: Best Neapolitan pizza in San Francisco hands down! The potato pizza, the Bianca pizza add prosciutto and the mushroom pizza are the best.
author: Blaine H.

description:
I hate to give a low rating to any restaurant. But in this city there isn't an excuse to serve mediocre food at any price. Unfortunately, our party of 9 unanimously agreed that none of us would recommend or return to A16. 

The Good: The staff was great. They graciously accommodated a last minute addition to our party - so nice!! The place was packed, but we still received pleasant, prompt attention from the plate servers, waiters, bussers, etc. Our waiter gave a delish wine suggestion. The burratta and panzanella salad were very good. 

The Bad: Our party of 9 (including 3 kids) ordered a lot of food. The pasta was fresh, but all 3 dishes were very bland. One of the kids ordered an anchovy-caper-olive pasta and said "this tastes like plain kid pasta!" She was right - totally bland. As was the lamb sugo, which uses lamb only to flavor the sauce, so it looks - and importantly tasted - like plain "kids" marinara sauce. When we expressed our disappointment with the 3 pastas, the staff was kind enough to substitute with the seafood pasta plate. It was overpoweringly fishy, yet somehow lacked flavor. The chicken meatball dish (which I think was over $30 for 5 small balls) had no sauce, instead served with an odd eggplant, raisin, nut "caponata" - waaaay too sweet. The meatballs were overcooked so sauce would have been welcome. If properly cooked the meatballs would have been tasty. The potato and cannelloni bean sides likewise lacked flavor. The cheese pizza was good, but really soggy on the inside. 

Ambiance: The restaurant is extremely noisy so you really can only hear the person next to or right across from you We sat at a long table at the bench wall, parallel to the stools at the kitchen bar. Those sitting in chairs at the aisle were constantly bumped by people and staff passing by - there really isn't enough room to comfortably sit there. 

Value: The pasta is offered in 2 sizes, and the "small" was shockingly small. In fact, all food portions were small. The prices were high, not in proportion to the small serving size or the quality of food. We all left somewhat hungry and very disappointed.
author: Robin G.

description:
Made a reservation two days ago for lunch and arranged to meet someone here. LESS THAN ONE HOUR BEFORE THE RESERVATION the restaurant called to tell me they had a private party!
A16 is another SF restaurant that is too full of themselves to worry about customer service. With all the choices in the city, it's not worth the effort to go there for a pizza.
author: Art C.

description:
+ margherite pizza was delicious
+ ohhhh the DESSERTS!
+ pork belly is a must have
+ polenta was really good too
author: Sherry L.

description:
Wine selection was good
Pizza crust was good but presentation was terrible and it was soggy
Pasta was overpriced and nothing to write home about
Good ambience and service 
Overall probably would not go back.
author: Jessica S.

description: Good pizza, undercooked pasta, small portions, overpriced food and wine, and terrible service. Go to Cotogna or Delarosa.
author: Matt D.

description:
I want to give this place more stars but both experiences have been very underwhelming. 

1. The service is terrible. You will not only wait forever for your food but also for water and anything else you wanted to drink. The hostess also makes you wait. If you have a 7pm reservation and show up at 6:55 they will seat you at 7:15 just so you wait around in a tight space.

2. It's expensive. The wine list is extensive but extremely pricey. The food is also over priced for pizza and pasta. We went on date night and it was $200 and when we went again as four people it was $375. 

3. The food is salty. Everything we tasted was just covered in salt. 

4. It's loud and hot in there. It's not romantic or comfortable.

5. For all the people in there there is only one ladies room. I had to wait in line for ten minutes. 

We went back a second time to see if the first time was just a bad experience. But the second time it was the same thing. On a positive note, the pizza is good. It's about the only positive thing about the whole place. Hence two stars. 

I emailed the restaurant to let them know how bad the service was and they never got back to me. I also thought that was interesting. 

Overall, don't go here. Go anywhere else in the marina. There are so many restaurants that are
Much better than A16.
author: Liza C.

description:
We sat along the "chef's table," but it really wasn't a table - it was more like a breakfast bar and you could watch all of the chef's make everyone's dinner.  Honestly - nothing exciting.  

The duck meatballs were the best part of our whole night, otherwise everything else was sort of "blah."  We sent back 2 sides, the salad and the cabbage, both left a nasty taste in the mouth. The burrata was delish and the octopus delish - but forget the potatoes. 

We did have excellent service - so we tipped on the service, but not the food.  And remember, the Chefs table is nothing special.
author: Lisa G.

description: Been to A16 twice. Great location. Definitely will repeat. Very good wine selection. Enjoyed both the entrees as well as the appetizers. The biggest compliment will be that I intend to come back for a third time.
author: Drew S.

description:
A great spot for a casual meal in the Marina.  A16 is the highway that runs through Naples in Italy, that explains the delicious Neapolitan pizzas coming from the wood-fired oven.  A16 is known for pizzas, squid ink pasta and a great  selection of Italian wines.

On a recent outing to A16, my party split a Margherita pizza and pork meatballs with a side of Calabrian chili Brussels sprouts.  Delicious!

There are many places for Italian cuisine in SF, A16 continues to draw crowds in a crowded market with their pizzas and casual ambience.  A16 is a super-kid friendly place, nearly half the tables had kids under the age of 10 at a recent Saturday afternoon lunch.

Come for the pizza then take a stroll through Crissy field  for some of the best views of the bay.
author: Lance W.

description: A16 is one of my favourite spots. The service is great and I enjoy how the setting is. Really good oven crust pizza. You'll never go wrong with the margherita pizza and their pastas are pretty good too. I've tried their squid in pasta. Definitely recommend coming here!
author: Jenn L.

description:
A-MAZE-ING! I booked a leadership dinner here and reserved the atrium for a stand up wine cocktail and appetizer start with a delicious coursed sit down dinner. Brian was absolutely beyond helpful in helping us setup our menu and even offered extra features day of. The food was sooooo good, I wish i could eat it everyday. Their menu is seasonal so right now they have a lot of squash & pumpkin on the menu - have you ever had pumpkin on pizza - well you're missing out if you answered no. They have some of the best pizza I have ever had. They also have an extensive wine list full of imported Italian wines- some really great varietals to explore. 

Would I go back? A million times yes
Would I book another event here? Yes - I would reserve more time so that we could enjoy the atmosphere, food and wine longer

This is a city gem and must try.

Enjoy!
author: Laura J.

description: Last night's dinner was lovely.  Def make a rezi.  They won't seat you until your whole party is there.  It's a little noisy, so larger groups will be yelling at each other.  The lentil soup is amazing!  The burrata was out of this world.  Limited choices if you are gluten free - thus the lentil soup and cheese. It's pretty expensive, but delish.
author: Cassie P.

description: Not a good experience from the start. Hot day in SF. My wife and I came in around 6:30. Asked for table away from heat. Host takes us to chef's table, a bar setting right by kitchen. Could feel temperature going up as we got closer. Told her we needed a cooler table. She seemed put out. Can't say our waiter was engaging, generally our experience with most staff we encountered. Praises for eggplant pizza. Salad recommendation good. Other pastas and desserts so so. We sent a dish back. At least our waiter was gracious about that. Extensive wine list. So many other restaurants in area gave us far more welcoming service and better food experiences at same or less price points. not inclined to return.
author: John L.

description:
A friend of mine worked there for 6 years and now lives abroad. He told me he would "kill for a bianca pizza" (KILL), so I went there, had one and nearly died, it was sooooo good! They'll give you scissors with the pizza to cut and share but you might not wanna share and stuff your face with the whole thing.
We sat at the chef's counter where you can see everything getting made with precision and attention to detail. The whole menu is mouth watering and nearly everything's cooked in the wood fire oven (calamari, steak, fish, vegetables etc...). There's an extensive wine list with a good mix of Italian and Californian wines. The restaurant itself is really nice too and the staff was lovely and helpful with recommendations for wine.
author: Olivia M.

description:
Overall this is the perfect date night place in the Marina. I love taking my girlfriend here for a meal or dessert whenever I can. 

Atmosphere - This place is much bigger than it seems on the outside. It extends all the way to the back of the building and has a cute little covered back patio. My girlfriend was wanting a romantic atmosphere one night, we found this place and she was very satisfied. It's cozy without being cramped. It's busy without feeling overwhelming. It's laid back and everyone is there to spend time with loved ones and friends.

Service - The whole staff is on point. The wait staff is always nearby and are checking in (but not too much). The water glasses are never empty. Really on point service.

Food - Their pizza is where it's at. My girlfriend and I usually get an appetizer and split a pizza and are satisfied. Honestly if you're looking to get full your bill might get a bit up there. If you're reasonable on the ordering you can make it out of here without dropping stacks. The desserts are so good too. Leaving room for dessert is definitely worth it.

Drinks - Their wine list is out of this world. They say it's one of the biggest in the country, but I'm always weary of claims like that. They have a nice by the glass menu that's not unreasonably priced (same prices you see everywhere else in SF).
author: Pierce S.

description: Mediocre food that if presented in any other neighborhood with different decor, would be recognized as such. Mystified by the high reviews. Especially given the prices for the value received. A $16 shaved asparagus salad delivered with curt and erratic service left me with a bad taste. This is our second time in as many years and will not return.
author: Lillian W.

description: I usually love A16 and find it to be the perfect spot which is why we were SO excited to celebrate our ENGAGEMENT here! We made a reservation at 10pm after a whirlwind day and figured they would be so nice (since experience is a big deal there). Instead, the waiter acted like we were lying and could've been a meme for "not impressed." He pushed $18/glass champagne and then charged us for it! A free dessert would've been a nice touch since the wine was a no-go. Oh well, we just won't be back and will make sure our friends avoid it as a celebratory place!
author: Kate B.

description: Fabulous dinner!  Such wonderful wines selection and foods.  Thanks Alex and Shawn for the wonderful service. Love everything ！ we will be back.
author: Betty L.

description: The music, the food, The wine, The service! Top notch. Everything A1 @ A16
author: John J.

description:
An early Friday night dinner...

Heads up, only beer and wine at this establishment. The service was impeccable. We never had an empty plate sitting in front of us nor an empty glass of water. One of the best service experiences I've had in a long time. 

The food...

Burrata appetizer - just ok

Pork belly appetizer (special) - horribly undercooked or bad piece. I order pork belly quite a bit at different places, and this was just a big miss.

Romana Pizza - FABULOUS. I could eat this every day. There's no cheese on it, but it's perfect. 

Asparagi Pizza - just okay.
author: Amy O.

description: Okay food. Way over priced for what you get, tables are tight together. Do not recommend if you want good Italian.
author: S B.

description: We had a terrible experience here.  The server accidentally poured a pitcher of water on the table.  This wasn't that big of a deal and we understood it was an accident.  We even helped clean up the table because we knew it was a mistake and didn't want him to feel bad.  The issue is the server and manager never apologized or fully cleaned up the table.  All they said was, "at least it's water" jokingly.  They continued to help others before even fulfilling our drink order for nearly 15 min.  So we decided to leave.  I even spoke to the server to explain why we were leaving and he didn't seem to care.  I dine out regularly and this is the poorest service I've had yet.  I wouldn't recommend eating here.
author: Nick K.

description: If you don't have a reservation, it's almost not worth it. I was told I'd have a 45 min wait. It was 1:20. Bartender was rude and would rather laugh w her friends than acknowledge me. Once I was sat the pizza was great. Not worth the money in my opinion. I won't return here.
author: Ruben C.

description:
Wow.  What a great experience.  Unfortunately, my husband and I were stuck in traffic, thus almost 30 minutes late for our reservation.  They only hold tables in the dining room for 15 minutes but were were seated at a cocktail table.  We actually preferred sitting in this area as it had more of a casual feeling to it.

Every dish we had was de-li-cious.  The Proscuitto Tasting was tasty, not at all salty.  The Squid Ink Pasta was cooked perfectly.  The Braised Short Rib was fork-tender, I practically didn't need the knife they gave me.  My husband's Maccaronara was probably the best dish of the night.  The Chocolate Budino Tart had the right amount of sweetness.  The Guava Buttermilk Sorbetto was incredible - just the right amount of sweet & tangy.

Everyone who waited on was uber friendly - Maribel, Penelope, Nikko & Reuben.

Great service, great food.  Nothing I could complain about.  Except for maybe the serving size of the Guava Buttermilk Sorbetto wasn't big enough.  ; )
author: Rose A.

description:
Been here several times in the past.  Great service and legit food.  Consistency has kept them here for over 10 years.

Any pizza is always on point.

I like all their pasta comes either small or large portions that way I can order more variety with small sizes.

Salumi super awesome, pork shoulder, spicy cotto and pork liver terrine.

Good bread and EVOO.

Good family times!

Hostess, wine girl and Daniel our server all awesome!
author: Kevin L.

description: Trendy, but the food and service support the crowds! Sit near the pizza oven and watch the action. Spent some time at the bar before our table was ready. Staff was very knowledgeable and the wine inventory was deep.
author: Brad R.

description: Our wait staff was awesome, and they were very responsive to any and all needs. However, for how much they charged for the food, the place was not very good.   The taste of the food was rather bland and watery, and of the 4 people I was eating with, nobody enjoyed their meal.  Wine was great, and ambiance was good.
author: Matthew H.

description: I loved this beautiful yet quaint restaurant. It was very busy and although we did make reservations we had to wait a bit but that was the only down side to this place. The wine I ordered was very good. They have an entire wine novel there, which i enjoyed since I'm a huge wine lover. The mixed olives and burrata were very tasty. My so and I ordered the margherita pizza and the orecchiette pasta. That was the best pasta I've ever had in my life OMG. So tasty! The pesto and pistachios complemented each other so well. The ambiance was romantic and the waiter we had was very nice and professional. I will definitely come back to this place in the near future!
author: Melissa M.

description:
I know that writing a review on how the food tasted is what I should focus on but I also believe that at the standard and price of this place, I should have at least a decent experience.

I knew this place was popular but my family and I chose to eat here because we happened to be walking along Chestnut St. , we were willing to wait and were told that the wait will be 45 minutes or so, and that they will text us when our table was ready. We came back after 45 minutes and the line was forming. 

I understand reservations come first which is fine ( no point in having a bad attitude for dinner). The hostess definitely tried her best to help us but it was the male floor manager that is earning this 1star review for this establishment. 

As people piled in, my mother and I overheard that there was another party of 3 without reservation and would have to wait 15-20 minutes (we were also a party of 3). We followed up multiple times that we have been waiting, and we see many free tables. The floor manager was very rude saying "this is a busy restaurant what do you expect?" And he couldnt have cared less about sitting my family. To make matters worst, the family after us got seated before us! The first thing I did was blame my mother for nagging the manager and that's probably why they got seated first but I don't think that's the case, he clearly was not professional. I can't help to feel that he judged us based on how we looked like ( Asians that have sport wear on) and probably assumed we wouldn't be contributing to his paycheck. Of course I don't want to say this is the reason but it makes you wonder.

After bugging him some more he seemed fed up and set up a tall table ( that seats 2) with an extra chair...that was empty this entire time we were waiting. He could have done that in the beginning, saved himself from the headache and us wasting our time!

Now to review food. We ordered meat platter appetizer ( pretty good), sausage pizza ( very good), and a pasta with nuts and some flowers? ( very fresh and light). Pizza is definitely like in Italy, very authentic and delicious. However, there are places just as great in the city for maybe half the price. 

This seems to be a great place to go get drinks and hang out but I would not be returning. The experience was not great and the food was not anything particular that no other place had.
author: Rose M.

description: Food is great - embrace is great - allowing dirty animals in without asking the right questions is unacceptable -
author: Tamas G.

description:
Who invites a bunch of Catholics to dinner on a Lenten Friday? Apparently my BFF does :( Despite all the food at our table, I'm rating the restaurant for the venue and service as I abstain from meat on Fridays during Lent... 

The restaurant is very modern and trendy... I'd suggest dressing the part. It's conveniently located in the Marina right off of Divisadero where parking is a nightmare but at least you get your workout after a full meal trekking back to your car :) We had a fairly large party and were seated along the walkway that connects the front of restaurant to the back. In this area you feel like you're in a private section because no other tables surround you, but you get a lot of the servers walking by constantly. The good about that: always have table needs met! The bad about that: can feel a little busy. It was wonderful to constantly have our table being swept for empty plates and drink refills. 

The servers suggested great wine and drinks and were very attentive at ensuring our glasses were never empty for more than a few minutes. The prix fixe menu was selected in advance by my friend. A table of 13 and we had plenty of food all for just $55 per person. Our drink bill was actually more expensive than the food!! Buncha winos... with nothing but great feedback on the beer selections, cocktails, and wine options. 

For the bird-sized bites I did get to try...
The margherita pizza was delicious!! I had 3 slices of cheesy basil goodness. 
Chocolate tart with olive oil and sea salt was soft, moist, and just the right hint of sea salt for flavor
Rubarb tart - served with vanilla ice cream and I could have had the entire thing to myself... thank goodness I try to control my binges in public.

I can't wait to venture back to actually eat some other dishes! See my photo for the menu. All of my friends really liked the food... Too bad I don't have much to comment on... yet!
author: Krystal A.

description:
I don't usually start off a review talking about a food/wine pairing, but tonight's selection was amazing. 

Dinner was a shared pasta - the Gnocchi with pork and grana padano. We selected a wine that would go well with the starchy gnocchi and the panna bianco pizza. Think sharp cheese with creamy white sauce. We didn't want a heavy red but definitely wanted a red. This restaurant does not have any wines from Northern Italy so it was a bit tough when there's no Chianti or Barolo on the wine list. 

We chose a wine from the Mount Etna region - ashy, smoky, floral notes and complex but not heavy. The pairing with the smoked pork on the gnocchi was truly inspired. 

The wine: 2012 Passo Pisciaro Contrada Guardiola. $105 per bottle. The entree was $22. The Pizza was $17 or $18. Food portions are small - but that's authentic Italian and wonderful if you want to try several small plates. 

For dessert we had the pistachio semi-freddo (semi frozen) pie with rosewater meringue. Melt in your mouth. To say it was delicious does not give it justice. 

Why only 4 stars? It was noisy. So much so because a group of 6 sat at the next table and because of the acoustics at the back of the restaurant, it sounded like one woman was screeching and screaming. Loudly. Impossible to hear our server. But after they left, I realized there was music playing. Don't sit in the back. 

We will return and going to try the pork chop next.
author: Lisa M.
