Great service. Terrific ambiance. A tad small and cramped, but man the food was quite delectable and the people were all knowledgeable! It is a bit pricier for the portions, but a location like this is all about quality over quantity and WHOA the pizza hit the SPOT.

On top of that the pastas were amazing as well and on the spot and definitely curious, like the alfredo that almost had an Asian fusion hint to it. Of course it was all started by an amazing arugula salad. Everything I had a chance to taste here was great!

Definitely check it out and have a great time! I know I'll be back!

Cheers.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Our bruschetta appetizer was good. It is a non-traditional style that is well done. We ordered the pizza because the two entries we planned to order were unavailable - their online menu doesn't match their actual restaurant menu, which was incredibly disappointing! The scissors to cut the pizza was unique. They gave is an olive oil cake to make up for the menu disappointment. The cake was a nice touch. 
The restaurant atmosphere has a warm italian style, but is very loud. We struggled to carry on conversation.
author: W L.

description: Had the mushroom pizza as well as the potato pizza and both tasted good. Cheese was great and ingredients tasted fresh. Also tried the sardine pasta which was even better. The sardine taste was light but definitely noticeable and added a very nice seafood taste to the pasta. Had the mussel and clams appetizer along with the asparagus which was good but nothing too amazeballs. Our waiter was cool and very informative about the food. Service was good. Lots of wine on the menu and beer selection limited. Ambiance was very cool and the music selection awesome! Blockhead, M83, Washed Out, and Lorde!
author: Calvin C.

description:
Can't say I had a normal experience here, as I came for their NYE prix fixe last year (14-15) BUT i loved this restaurant. 

My boyfriend and I hate going out on NYE, so we take it as an opportunity to suit up and spend an obscene amount of money on a classy meal that makes us feel rich and elite (we're typically jeans-and-t-shirt netflix-and-chill kinda peeps with rich-people palettes). This restaurant really served that up in heaps. 

First, the price for NYE prix fixe was reasonable (I think around 125 each, and the average for sf is close to 250), and we managed to get a reservation on the day-of NYE (litchrally impossible) because of a last minute cancellation after which they immediately called us and offered us the slot. Points for reaching out to US instead of having us call back and check.

Can't remember what we ate, aside from it being "legit" dinner food and not pizza, I just remember raving about every single thing. Delectable meal. We wanted wine, and their wine menu is a frickin novel, so we had the sommelier come and make recommendations, and whatever he chose was the most unbelievable red wine I've ever had, according to me (love red wine and have tried lots of quality wine in Europe and South America) as well as my bf (thinks he hates red wine because all he knows is Franzia).  

The environment inside was romantic and intimate -- enough noise that everyone was having a good time, but pretty tame and we could hear each other -- and dim strategic lighting set a really date-y mood. Also, the way the staff treats you really does improve every aspect of the experience. My bf and I look younger than we are (and we're in our mid-20s), so I always expect people can tell we're un-fancy and will treat us like the wannabes we are, but every single person in this resto (and especially the sommelier!) treated us like the President and First Lady, pampering our every whim. I loved it. 

Oh, and my pet peeve in restaurants is how long they take to fill waters. This is definitely a "keep every glass full at all times" kind of place.
author: Gisela I.

description:
really 3.5 stars...esp if I ordered the right thing.

Pizzas here are definitely the best thing to get. I unfortunately made the mistake of getting mussels.  Undercooked and under-seasoned. I was disappointed. I guess that's what I get for ordering a french dish in an italian restaurant.

Pizzas are huge and delicious - even the crust is one of the better crusts I've ever eaten. Good for dates. The no reservation policy is pretty inconvenient and the space is not great for groups.
author: Alice Z.

description:
This restaurant's lay out is really welcoming - the wine bar to the right and the option to sit at the chef's table is awesome. The food however, is not so great.
The pizza (tried the fungi) was ok - The crust was nice, but the pizza in general lacked flavor, and honestly all you could taste was the earthiness from the mushroom. I would prefer to have a pizza with well balanced flavor, so that all the toppings can be tasted rather then one over powering component. 
The yellowfin crudo was too salty. Small slivers of yellowfin with a thin radish and a ton of sea salt really isn't appetizing - 
The Maccaronara was not impressive. The noodles were hand made which was great - but if you are going to make them from scratch the texture and noodle better taste good. Unfortunately when I received this dish there were 7 noodles all clamped together - sorry not a fan of knots in my pasta. The sauce was just ok - nothing to sing about.
The only thing that stood out from the meal was the homemade pistachio ice cream. It wasn't overly sweet and it had a lovely taste.
But with all the said - I am not here to have ice cream, I am here to eat some good Italian food and unfortunately this is not what I got.
author: Allie P.

description: I have been coming to A16 ever since it opened and I have always had an above and beyond experience. But I am writing today because if I could give 6 stars I would. We celebrated my mother's birthday, all 19 of us, last Sunday. We have some very specific diners and many who dine out a lot. Not 1 single complaint. All praises. From the ambiance, the service and the food, it was an all star cast. We are all still raving about our incredible lunch and we ALL cannot wait to go back. Thank you A16 for being so wonderful and creating such a memorable afternoon!
author: rosita t.

description: SF's Best Restaurant! My wife and I come so often out here, it's amazing. They treat us very well every time and the wine is just exceptional. Their Italian wine selection is unparalleled and their food is amazing. They have the best Neapolitan pizza outside of Europe and their burrata appetizer dish is so tasty. I recommend everyone in SF to try this place at least once!
author: Samir J.

description: Buzzing, pumping (yet cosy) atmosphere and really packed - meant that service (at the reception and at the bar) was a bit slow but that you really felt "in the heart of things". Service in the restaurant was super efficient though. Food was very good especially the appetizers and the pizza, and we had a delicious and well-priced bottle of white wine served at perfect temperature (and the waitress discreetly made sure our glasses never stayed empty!). I really recommend this place if you're looking for a hipster/ authentic combo and nice Italian meal.
author: Helene D.

description:
Was stoked to try this place - They have a good location, cool ambiance, and they made the Michelin Bib Gourmand list (reliable source in the past). They don't have a full bar (just wine and beer), which is fine but something good to know before going. 

I gave this place two stars because my entrée was horrible. I would have sent it back but I was with some new friends and didn't want to be "that guy". I ordered the Black Pepper Fettuccine and it tasted EXACTLY like ramen noodles (chicken flavor). Two other people at my table ordered the same dish and they both agreed. Our starters were good, pizza was good (I was told), wine was decent, but the entrée was disgusting.
author: Kyle M.

description: Having gotten a rave review from a friend, I was really expecting more give the high price tag. The food portions were very small and I was really disappointed by the taste. The wait staff was nice, but the menu was confusing and felt a bit like if you weren't an expert in Italian food you were out of luck in deciphering what anything was. The authentic Italian descriptions were confusing and when I tried to ask what some of the items were, I felt like I was being spoken to in a foreign language. Maybe I'm just not enough of a foodie for a place like this. I had better luck googling the dishes than asking a server. However, the dessert and coffee were good and my date and I ended up switching our dishes and enjoying them much more. The atmosphere is nice, spacious, and modern and the open kitchen was much less disruptive than I thought I'd be.
author: Kay P.

description: Ate here on a Saturday night. Had a 9pm reservation for 2 and they tried seating me in their section right off the bar at a high table with bar seats. It's a really uncomfortable area and I'm really surprised they try to seat people with reservations there. I asked to be reseated and by about 9:15 I was seated towards the back of the restaurant, which is much better. We had a beet salad, which was just OK and a pizza, which again, was just OK. The food took far too long and we walked out the door at 10:45. This is a really sexy place but lacks substance and flavor. Might try it again in about a year.
author: Alex C.

description:
Service gets a 5, food gets a 2.5, value gets a -1.

Judging from the size and dress of the crowd, this is clearly a very popular place for people to go on special occasions.  There are much better options.

First off, let me say that our service was top-notch.  Everyone greeted us nicely, the server was very knowledgeable about both the wines and the menu items, and she was extraordinarily gracious (and helpful) in finding a new wine when the first one didn't turn out as we expected.

The entrees were disappointing.  One of us had a sirloin steak, which, despite being ordered medium rare was dried out and tough.  The lamb sugo over pasta consisted of a very large bowl of pasta with somewhere between 1-2 Tablespoons of sugo.  There wasn't really enough sauce to even discolor all of the pasta.  At $25-35 per entree, it's not a place to which I would return.
author: Kraig M.

description:
Probably the worst dining experience in a long time, 
 Went in on Fathers Day on a whim.
 Ordered 2 glasses of wine at $12 a pop for very standard wines. I always close out tab at before dining so I can tip bartender which I did so generously and he said he would close out tab, I paid in cash. Back to this later
 Seated right by the kitchen and that was fine, but, I began noticing the food coming thru the pass was less that stellar looking, Why does everyone with a wood fired oven under cook pizzas?
 We ordered the Chicken liver appetizer, which was cooked to a very black char, almost inedible.
I had the Beef Short Rib ($36.00) which was a 3 ounce portion at best and the broth.. yes broth it came in was so salty I had to return it, I asked the waiter to taste and he agreed , the manager came over and apologized in an agonizing way, no doubt she had many others in the restaurant beckoning her over to complain. My girl friends  pasta was way to aluyn dente and was so small I was aghast as she was at everything.
 Ordered 2 more glasses of wine during dinner
 The charred green beans were very good, the only thing that was the entire night.
Tried the chocolate budino tart and was very disappointed, dry , seemed a few days old, tasted like the walk in cooler air. had coffee with dessert
 Now the bill came to ,,, drum roll roll please $159.50 .. Whaaaaaa ? 
 4 glasses of wine 1 appetizer ,2 entrees , 1 dessert ,2 coffees.
 In checking the bill I noticed that the $ 12.00 glasses of wine were now $15.00 and 4 were on the bill, bartender did not close out bar tab... what happened to the cash I gave him and the promise to close out bill. 
  How does a glass of wine raise $3 bucks per glass from bar to the dining room? 
 $60.00 for 4 glasses of wine... 2 of them never should have appeared  on bill to start with.
 The beef short rib was so bad even on the when re-fired it was still way over salted. 
 I told the waiter about this his  rolled eyes and shrugged:" I will get manager".
 In her defense she was very apologetic and corrected the bill with out hesitation,
Pretty much terrible food, sketchy bar keeper, waiter that could not seem to get the idea we were having a bad time eating there
All this on Fathers Day no less..........
author: Craig S.

description: Hardwick was her name, & she was fantastic.  As soon as she told us the Macaronarra was a staff favorite, we were in it to win it.  You are sure to walk away with a doggy bag from A16.  It was a special night for my girl & I, & definitely a meal to remember.  Their Olive Oil, Out of this World.
author: Gary B.

description: This restaurant is amazing. Light Californian/ Italian using only the freshest ingredients. Amazing service every time. Great for all types of people who like food. The pizzas are delectable! A must visit for something unique and fun but not overly trendy so much so that it's pretentious. Service always great. We often send clients and guests here for a 100 % of the time amazing experience. Thank you A-16!!
author: Alex F.

description:
When we arrived we were seated immediately as we had reservations.
Shortly wine was ordered and poured.  But then it was quite awhile
before a server was seen again.  Eventually he made it back but in
the middle of taking our order he abruptly left for another table two over
and took their order & answered questions at the table next to us.  When
he came back there was nary an apology for his rudeness.  Without good
service there are plenty of places to get a good pizza in SFO.
author: Susan K.

description: I thought that I was being punked.  I kept looking around for the video cameras & for someone to pop out & let me in on the joke.  It never happened, this was the unfortunate true reality.  OK, it was a Tuesday night, so maybe we got the "B" or "C" team, but it was more like the "Z" team, for Zombies.  This used to be our go to place to bring out of towners to.  Now I wish that I had gone out of town myself instead.  Unfortunately we did bring friends from out of town here tonight, party of 6. How frigging embarrassing the whole experience was.  It was like the restaurant was being run by a gaggle of stressed out high schoolers.  Not one smile or apologetic statement for what was truly the worst restaurant experience I've had in 4-5 years.  50 minutes after ordering our entrees, 5 out of our six party members finally received their meals.  3 very average trout dinners, one bland and unappealing chicken dish (was supposed to be roasted, but they brought the meatballs instead), a gnocchi dish that was about 9 rubber balls floating in some dirty water with chunks of tomatoes, and we waited for the 6th entree (pasta in squid ink sauce), and we waited, and we waited........ 20 minutes later some lady dropped a small goat cheese pizza that no one wanted on our table and proclaimed "this is our present to you", no further explanation.  So we asked, "where's our 6th entree?", some mumbling ensued that none of us could understand.  All of a sudden we became the invisible table.  No one met our eyes, no one came by to explain or apologize.  A full 35 minutes after our first 5 entrees had arrived (and someone in our party sought out what passed as management), and everyone else was done pecking at their substandard food, the pasta dish finally arrived with the magnanimous gesture "we will comp" this entree.  We all rolled our eyes, asked for the still very overpriced check, and skidaddled ASAP.  There are no excuses for this type of service and food quality from what used to be one of our favorite restaurants.  Sure, we might have hit an off night, but this was equivalent to waiting for 2 hours at the dentist, and then being poked in the eye while he pulls your teeth out.  My advice, run away from this establishment while you still have some years left to live.
author: Herb S.

description:
Service was surprisingly bad for such an established restaurant.  The food was okay, which is probably why they're still around.  

This made me laugh out loud:  bear in mind this is a Monday night, the 'occasion' is meeting a colleague after work.  I described what we were looking for in a wine, and the recommendation was for a $1,000++ bottle.  
  
I am not sure in what universe that makes any sense.
author: Jaina S.

description:
This place is legit.

Good pizza, good spaghetti, great drinks.  Though the chicken liver with croutons bread is a bit over cooked and lacks the liver taste.
author: Jon L.

description: An honest 2 star experience. The service was awful. When we finally got a hold of the waiter, he admittedly didn't even like half the menu. We kept asking for his recommendation and his response was: eh it's ok and unfortunately he was right. The chicken livers were overlooked and just awful. The pasta was flavorless and the peppers were so spicy that there wasn't a finished plate in the house. After sending back a couple dishes for being overly salted and a waiter who just seemed to be there to pass the time; this once great restaurant is one of the worst in the area.
author: Victor M.

description:
So disappointed - after reading great reviews, with selection confirmed as a good choice by concierge, we took a not-inexpensive cab ride here Saturday night, bypassing closer restaurants offering similarly described fare. Once seated, however, the din was so overwhelming that I could not even talk with my dinner companion across the little table. I don't mind vibrant, high-energy noise levels, but this was jet-takeoff noise levels. We tried to endure but in little time and after several "what?"s, both of us gave up and opted to bail. 
I bet the food's good but I can't put up with ambience (or lack of it) that so detracts from the dining experience. 
Good news ending: Causwell's across the street offered a delightful bar and a killer burger, so it wasn't a totally wasted excursion.
author: E H.

description:
Love this place. 

I always come here for pizzas. If you have out of towners visiting, this place is a must.  The food is here amazing, great ambiance (though it can get loud at times) and fantastic wine selection.   The Quintessential SF restaurant, this is how I see A16.  

I've been here 3 or 4 times and every time the food quality is consistently good.  Their menu does rotate, we always get the pizza as its one of our top restaurants for pizzas.  This place is a must for pizza lovers.  It's neapolitan style, so get the margarita for sure. 

Apart from the pizza, from the times I've been here I've also had:  

- The pork belly, so delicious, but its an appetizer so there's not much of it to go around.
- Jalapeno poppers - These babies are spicy. The smaller they are, the spicier they are. 

They are on the pricier side, expect to pay 2-3 times what you would for wine normally and food.  But they do make up for it in quality and service. 

They also get very busy.  Reservations are a must.  And most of the time you would need to book ahead for at least a day or 2.   

Hints:
- Try to ask for a table at the back of the restaurant or outside as it would be quieter. 
- Use their valet service when available, parking around the area is a nightmare. 
- It will be easier for you to get a seat or do a walk in for an early or late session, so if its last minute, go around 5/5:30 or 9/9:30 to try and get a table. 
- This place is good for large groups and children, but I would suggest you book ahead and get a table towards the back away from the crowded bar area at the front of the house.
author: Maggie F.

description:
Staff is UNFRIENDLY, UNATTENTIVE, & ARROGANT.  

Stopped in to have a glass of wine with friends on a Friday night.  The place was not busy so we thought it would be quick and relaxing. The host seated us at the front window (arms length from the bar, it's a tiny place) and gave us a beverage menu.... then we waited... and waited. 

I finally got up and walked over the a hostess (now a short blonde girl instead of the first gentleman). She was staring at her cell phone and, after I said 'excuse me' for the 3RD TIME, she finally lifted her head.  I asked if anyone would be taking our drink order and she said we had to order at the bar.  

No problem... I walked back to the bar where I was the only person standing and waiting to place an order.  There were 8 or so patrons sitting at the bar, well into their dinner courses.  Three bartenders continued on behind the bar like I was invisible.  I again waited... and waited.  

After feeling very uncomfortable lingering over the dining patrons and being completely ignored by the well staffed, yet unresponsive bartenders, I was finally able to place an order for 3 drinks... but only after getting another dose of arrogance from the bartender, Chad. 

WE WON'T BE BACK...
author: Jen H.

description:
Sat at the bar and enjoyed a glass of wine and a couple appetizers.  Really like the bartender there, very good at making recommendation. 

What we had:
Victory Prima Pils - $6/bottle - for hubby

glass of Villa Raiano Taurasi - $16 - earthy with a nice herbal undertone - smooth, bold and delicious

Trippa Napoletana - $10 -  tripe stewed with onions, tomato, white wine and bread crumbs - very tender and full of flavor, what a homey dish!

squid ink cavatelli with tomato, braised calamari and castelvetrano olives - $10 - first time trying cavatelli and liked the texture.  too bad it was not piping hot as expected - just warm.
author: Gloria H.

description: Really nice environment here ... very friendly service ... Food is delicious ... Restaurant is full. You can sit at a bar or even better at a kitchen to see how their cooks prepare all food - is really good to see how gets your own order prepared . Definitely recommend visiting.
author: Veru B.

description: Everything about this restaurant is superb, delicious food, the sommelier was beyond knowledgeable, lovely servers, beautiful and cozy.  Looking forward to coming back to San Francisco
author: Melanie A.

description: I'm writing this because it's been a while since I've felt full but unsatisfied. The food was overly salted.. Especially the burrata and the Romana pizza, aka the salt bomb. The calamari linguini was also dry with very few pieces of calamari in it. What saved the experience was the service and the ambience, but ultimately we all left wishing someone had warned us not to go to A16.
author: Christina P.

description:
Went here for dinner with my boyfriend last night... and it was pretty good!  We had one of the pizzas and the duck pasta.  Honestly.. the pasta wasn't much.  It tasted kind of like salt water and the duck was almost nonexistent.  Boo.  Pizza was pretty good, really spicy if you like that!  

We sat by the kitchen so we got a show of all the chefs cooking while we ate which was great.  The margarita pizza looked delicious and so did the clam special. The real reason this place gets four stars is for the wine.  It was fabulous.  I had what I would say was my favorite glass of wine to date.  I took a picture of the bottle after so I could remember what it was (Marina Cvetic).  The bartenders are great and if you tell them what kind of wine you want, they will deliver a great glass.  


 Next time I'd order something different, but we both want to go back and try some other things. :)
author: Brooke S.

description:
If you want to get ripped off with little food in your plate and expensive prices for what you'll get, go to this restaurant.

- The food we ordered tasted so bland and so short of stuff (mainly sauces) they could have mixed in that was ridiculous
- The desert shown in this page was so, so salty-- and  I love  salt-- that we could not eat the bottom half
- The small pizza was made with cheap flour and some red sauce, that probably cost them 25 cents to make

We did not try the entire menu, but the sample should  speak a lot about the overall menu.
We paid over $150 for the three of us, and truly liked the t glasses of wine and the ice cream.
To me, and I eat at a lot of restaurants, the whole food was worth no more than $50, not considering the other factors mentioned above....
author: Wil R.

description:
It is likely I could come back to try the pizza  but for now, meh.  

We ordered pumpkin bruschetta and had I not been able to see it and touch it I would swear our friendly server never brought it from the kitchen.  That's how lacking in flavor it was.  An onion carmelized in balsamic with a few substantial grains of sea salt and perhaps a dash of cayenne could have remedied this problem.

Next we had the baked ricotta with kale and pomegranate seeds.  It was light and healthy and pretty on the plate but the cheese was bland and something just wasn't jiving.  Perhaps if the kale was slightly warm and wilted and the ricotta was swapped for baked brie and little raisin crositinis were present....

Gnocchi for my main.


That's all.
author: Leah G.

description:
I really don't understand how this place is always packed....then again you are somewhat limited in the restaurant category in the Marina.  

Let me start off by saying the service we experienced was awful, not only did our server steer us away from dishes saying that it's the worst thing on the menu, you shouldn't get it (gnocchi), the GM told us group of gals that we were too loud in a loud restaurant.  Very shocking. 

Ok,..back to the food...We ordered the octopus which was very chewy, and salty.  Some slices on the Margarita Pizza didn't even have any cheese on it, so basically I was just eating some baked bread with red sauce.  The other dishes I already forgot about so I guess they were not even memorable to mention!   

I honestly will not go back!
author: Jackie L.

description:
It was 8:30 pm on a cool San Fransisco night in October and we were ready for some good food. A 16 was recommended by many at the LinkedIn conference so we took the bait. 

We enter and we were greeted with gusto. It was a 2 minute wait as we had reservations and our party of 3 was quickly seated. 

Because of YELP food photos--we made our selections. The pasta with clams, the pizza and a kale salad. 

We got the pasta and it was delicious and we shared one order. The pizza ( which was fun cutting with the shears placed on the table) was so tasty and fresh. In fact the place is a little warm because of the huge pizza oven in the center of the space. 

Service was good. Food was tasty. Neighborhood was cool. It's a must go!
author: Nando R.

description:
Really swank place. Well decorated and great view of the open kitchen where the pizzas are being made. Supposed to be one of the most authentic places to get an italian pizza but maybe i'm just not that into authentic, which in some cases nowadays means less than exciting and sometimes even archaic.

On a more serious note, I hate that pizza here gets served on a ceramic plate. By doing that all the condensation collects beneath the pizza and renders the bottom soggy. You lose the crispness you tried to achieve by baking in a big wood-fired oven and that's just a shame. Crispness is something to be celebrated. Wish the desserts here took advantage of the oven somehow just to round out the experience.

Also had a ragu napoletano which is special for its extraction of meat flavor from various meats used to start the base of the sauce, after which the meats are discarded...but really didn't feel like the sauce reflected a full extraction. Tasted more like tomato than anything else. This could've just been a waste of meat that could've been purposed whole otherwise.
author: Brian N.

description: I've been to A-16 many times over several years and I never leave unhappy. Today's lunch: Simple bowl of trippe with a side of hari covert. Both were delicious. One thing you can be certain of at A-16, a good glass of wine. It was a perfect lunch.
author: David A.

description:
A16 - what can I say? The hype machine is working over-drive with this place.

The place is always buzzing and always seems incredibly crowded. The space is much bigger than you think, but it is a very loud setting. They need to throw some carpets or clothe on the walls, it feels like I'm in a tin box.

Onto the food. The appetizers are perfectly fine, nothing makes your taste buds do back flips, but the burrata was a solid 4 stars.

For main courses, I'd stick to the Pizzas as everything else is unspectacular. The pizzas are easy and 3.5-4 stars, but everyhting in general is over priced at this place. When you get the bill and you look back on your evening, don't say I didn't warn you that you feel a little like you got fleeced.
author: Justin O.

description: Honestly rudest hostes ever. Will never come back here again. 25 minute wait for our table and told no one knew we were waiting. Was a loyal fan of this place until tonight.
author: Nichole B.

description: Uh, this review is for the pizza only. It is nom nom effin nom! Do you know what i mean? Thin crust heaven in only ninety secs. Thx you, A16.
author: Pickle R.

description: Fresh, delicious and atmosphere provides dark tables and abundant natural light! Quality simple ingredients prepared and cooked perfectly!
author: Hayley M.

description: We took some friends who wanted to try it out because it's been on the top 100 for quite a few years now. Although my husband and I have tried it a few times and we're not impressed. This time was even worse than the others. First off they sat us at the worst table ever. Wedged in the corner on an odd shaped booth that made it utterly impossible to talk. It's already super noisy and then we are seated in a long row not across from each other. We had to yell to even try and communicate. We ordered several dishes to share. The olives and Salumi plate was pretty good. A fish dish that was bony. The Bucatini was mediocre and when we asked for bread the waiter said we don't do bread. What the heck kind of Italian restraunt doesn't do bread??? The pizza was just ok but I really hate the scissors. You can't slice the pizza for me before you bring it out??? The wine tasty but very exspensive. We spent over $300 for a subpar dinner. Will never go back. Too pretentious and way over priced.
author: Candia M.

description: Disappointed to say the least, and sad to knock a well-established neighborhood establishment.  However, service and food quality has taken a tumble.  Had a reservation and was seated fairly promptly but it took nearly 30 mins for waitstaff and sommelier to acknowledge us.  Waitress was apathetic and not sync with somm, we had to keep flagging down bussers and hostesses for service.  Wine was mediocre at best and definitely not along the profile we had requested.  For a take of 4, ordered quite a spread - apps and sides, pizza, pasta, and mains.  Portions were small, pasta attempted to be al dente (but came out undercooked), pizza was underwhelming and far too salty, salad was bland and also over salted.  Collectively our group was not impressed and will not be back.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Thinking about the cavatelli dish makes my mouth water. The combination of the dense pasta, escarole, currants, cauliflower and parmesan comes highly recommended. 

The atmosphere is wonderful. Even sitting at the chef's bar in the back was a delightful experience as you get to see the chef's preparing the food.
author: Courtney B.

description:
We brought our own bottle of wine, it's $25 for the service, but since the wine at A16 is expensive this is worth it. I asked to have the wine decanted and it just worked out great. The food was amazing as always, ordered the mozzarella di búfalo, the prosuito pear apetizer and a pizza Margarita - Just fantastic. 
We sat at the chefs counter by the pizza over and it was quite entertaining.
author: Eduardo S.

description:
Nothing special here.  That said, the pizza was tasty and the seat at the chefs bar was fun.
But that is where the compliments end.  Generally the food is very pedestrian, one would expect more.  A16 used to be much better years ago, but it has slipped big time.  Mediocre food and overpriced.

To top it off, I left a 20% tip, but they overcharged my credit card on their system.  I called 3 times and sent 2 emails.  No answer.  I now have to dispute the charge with my credit card company.  Very disappointing!
author: J K.

description:
Cute little place in the Marina, with a European feel.  I've sat at the chef's counter both times I've been which has been fun, but it would be nice to sit in the main dining room. Make reservations in advance!

I've had a few things here: mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and eggplant, the prosciutto tasting plate, the maccaronara with ragu & ricotta salad, the roasted cucumber salad, and the bianca pizza.  All were amazing.  The service has been good both of the times that I've been in, as well.

This spot would be really great for a cute date night!
author: Taylor L.

description:
A16 was at sf food fest 2011(8/20). they had their own people there and they were selling a lot of spicy  meatballs (3).  cannolis(3), and watermelon/limeade fresca was also served.

sampled their cannoli,  found the shell to be semi-hard, not delicately flaky like romolo's, the cream about the same, less sweet and  the pistachio kind of stingy.      sorry, just 3 stars

the meatballs would no doubt be 4 stars but evaluations are made on actual not speculative.

foodnotes:
-no lines, very well organized.
-order and get your food within minutes.
author: Victor G.

description:
A16 is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in SF and has been since the first week it opened years ago. I've been back countless times since then with friends, family, dates... even for NYE.

Sommelier Shelley Lindgren is not only very talented with an eye towards interesting and unusual picks, but also very warm and personable. I rarely see her there these days but her influence is still easily seen on the vast wine menu.

In the 30+ times I've eaten at A16, I've never had anything I didn't really like and I don't say that lightly. Personal favorites include the Burrata, all pizzas (Neapolitan style, amazing wood-fired crust), gnocchi with lamb & porcini ragu. This week we also enjoyed the pork meatballs (a Monday night specialty) and grilled sirloin served over cavalo Nero. The meatballs were moist and light, melt-in-your-mouth delights. The sirloin was also mouthwatering but the real star of that dish was the cavalo Nero (Tuscan kale). Desserts are all good; hard to go wrong there.

Reservations are still hard to get unless you plan ahead and the bar area in front is tiny so don't assume you can hang out there until something opens up. Still, I find it difficult to say anything bad about A16. I've only had good experiences and it remains one of my favorite places in a city with countless great restaurants.
author: Dana P.

description:
My bf and I came here to celebrate my new job last week, I wasn't too excited about it, but I'm so stoked that we decided to come here.  We actually had a table reservation at 8:30 but luckily two seats opened up at the bar and it really made all the difference!

We were served by the bartender Alex (I think that was his name, but I'm not 100% sure) and he is amazing!  He knows his wine and the menu and he was able to pair everything we ate to a wine that complemented it well. We even ended our meal with this fun carbonated pink wine.  Honestly, I don't know shit about wine, but my bf does and he was super impressed!  He even gave us some background information on the vineyards! It was great!

The food was also really good, especially the mussels.  I could eat some right now haha. We also got the burrata, a pizza and a half pasta.  Although the food was good, the bartender is really what made this experience so great! We will DEFINITELY be back in the near future!!
author: Marisa R.

description: This place is a churn and burn Italian restaurant.  The food was fine, the service was good, and the atmosphere was parochial from a design stand point.  All of that said, nothing stood out to me as noteworthy and I can't imagine going back unless someone else planned it (especially because I live on the East Coast).  The place was packed and loud as well...so either this is a fantastic location or San Franciscans aren't privy to good Italian on the west coast.
author: Tyler L.

description:
Awesome. 

I love this place - the kale salad I had was so tasty and fresh, I could have eaten it everyday. 

The pizza was also super tasty - they give you scissors to cut it with. 

Atmosphere is nice - clear and classy, but also relaxed.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Named after a highway in Italy and finally finding an opportunity to dine here, the anticipation of the acclaimed food at A 16 got my motor runnin', but ended up leaving me feeling stuck in neutral.  Three stars for the food might be a little generous.  I wasn't impressed, but the food wasn't bad either.

Partook of the burrata cheese drizzled with olive oil, the funghi neapolitan pizza, ricotta gnocchi with guinea hen sugo, and the blueberry hazelnut cake with apricots for dessert.  For two of the dishes I ordered here I've ordered similar dishes elsewhere in SF which were just more memorable -- Luce's burrata was amazing and Zero Zero's Fillmore was a more enjoyable mushroom pizza.

Overall, the food was fine though I probably won't be rushing back any time soon, value is decent, atmosphere is nice, and our waitress was excellent -- attentive and professional.

(Second review in a row for a restaurant named after a road in Europe.  Are there any more in SF?  Might as well make a list.)
author: Erich D.

description:
Came here for after graduation hoping for just a nice little spot. Everything was awesome except for our server, Daniel. 

There was a wonderful and gracious guy who came to our table before our waiter did and got us water, I wish HE had been our waiter. 

The food and drinks were good and honestly, we probably would've ordered more had it not been for Daniel. When we did order our food, I asked for an appetizer of bread and olive oil and he didn't bring it out until AFTER we were done with our main courses. It was the strangest thing. 

A16, thank you for the good food, the good atmosphere and a mostly good time. Please make sure your staff is held to a higher standard.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
The burrata was perfectly soft and velvety.  The mushroom pizza was excellent, and the bottom stayed crispy - just perfect. The kale salad was also fantastic with the smallest pine nuts. 

It was quiet at lunchtime, and service was really good, until near the end of the meal - then it was a little slow. Relatively minor compared to the food!
author: Jon H.

description:
Even thought here was nothing left on open table, they were able to make room for us at one of the high top tables pretty last minute on a Sunday, even with our party of 7.  We were seated in kind of an awkward location, but it ended up working out ok. 

They don't have a full bar but do have wine/beer.  We brought a few bottles, and they actually did free corkage as long as we ordered a bottle from their list.   We ordered all the food family style, which I highly recommend...

Starters:
- Burrata: house made, could have used a bit more salt, but very fresh, good on crostini (you can ask for extra crostini since there's much more burrata than bread)
- Octopus: braised, with sweetness from cubanelle peppers. The potatoes were flavorful, but I loved the braised pear in the dish
- Arugula salad: generous size, great for sharing. Lots of greens piled up, topped with pluots, peaches, fried almonds, and pecorino. The dressing was surprisingly light
- Zuppa de zuca: not exactly for sharing, but it's a pretty big sized bowl. It's a light, summer soup (broth based).

Pizzas: i like that they give you shears to cut your own, which makes it more fun. Also, try the chili oil with the pizzas!
- Funghi: lots of mushrooms, would have been nice with the proscuitto add on.  Too bad they didn't have truffles or truffle oil
- Margherita: the true test of a pizza place. It was sweet from the tomatoes, and you can upgrade to mozzarella de bufala for $4 more
- Salsiccia: tons of mozzarella, fennel sausage, greens - nice and meaty 

Pastas: 
- Buccatini: Incanto had made me fall in love with tuna heart.  The one here is lighter, but the pasta texture is better - very al dente
- They also made a vegetarian version of the buccatini for my mom, which had more tomatoes
- Gnocchi with braised rabbit: the gnocchi texture was ok for me, but the braised rabbit was pretty amazing. It was lean but very flavorful, light and hearty at the same time
- Squid ink tonnarello: al dante, great texture, loved the dark squid ink. There was also braised squid, fried breadcrumbs, with a nice hint of lemon and garlic

Entrees/sides: 
- Steak: medium rare, good to share if everyone wants just a little bit of meat. It was good but not extraordinary
- Cannellini beans: creamy, not bad considering I'm not a big bean fan
- Oven roasted broccoli: great roasted flavor, which brought out the sweetness of the broccoli, and it was just slightly caramelized. I highly recommend this one

Desserts: 
- Fig sorbet: good seasonal flavor, but I didn't love it
- Almond pound cake: with strawberries and balsamic. It was a very dense and generous portion but is good for sharing. The strawberries are like one last taste of summer. I wish it were ice cream instead of creme fraiche on top
- It wasn't on the menu, but as they had gelato, we requested affogatos, and they were able to make them. The espresso over vanilla gelato was perfect and exactly what I needed!

Our poor server was caught in the middle of a fight to pay for the bill, but he was very gracious about it. Parking can be a bit tricky around here, so you may want to give yourself a little extra time. Definitely make a reservation, and order family style!  Prices are pretty reasonable, which explains why it made the Michelin Bib Gourmand list.
author: Marilyn H.

description:
I adore A16.

This is one of my SF favorites for many reasons. 

- For starters, their service is superb -- every time. 

- The energy throughout is vibrant and enjoyable. 

- The restaurant seats late which makes it a perfect venue for an after-show dinner or late night date.

- And the food! It's the best Italian fare with focuses on their infamous burrata, the paccheri pasta, and a must -- the margherita pizza. For dessert, the chocolate date cake will take you over the edge.

- And to top it all -- their wine list surpasses 500.

It's a winner. You won't be disappointed.
author: Caroline S.

description: Delicious food, not that great of a wait staff but that's okay in this case. This restaurant makes magnificent new age italian dishes and is a very cool atmosphere. I would recommend this place to both locals as well as tourists, but please no fanny packs.
author: Shak K.

description:
Ate here for the first time last night. I did not check the other Yelp reviews until after I ate there and so I was shocked to see the bad reviews! Those people may have been there on an off night or just have no idea what they're talking about. This place is incredible!

The burrata was among the best I've ever tasted as were their various prosciuttos. I also had the short-ribs which was one of the more flavorful dishes I've ever had. Great wine list too! The service was also immaculate.

I suppose if you're used to eating at Chili's you may not appreciate A16 but for us foodies it's definitely worth a trip.
author: James S.

description: I love Burrata, so I had taken a peek at the menu and knew I wanted to pop in to try it. The burata is amazing, but then again, it's amazing down the street as well for half the price. The pasta was not good, there was no meat in the sauce and it was literally the smallest $22 pasta I've ever seen. No, scratch that, I've eaten amazing pasta that is worth its weight in gold. This wasn't it. I don't understand the raves, but hey, everyone is allowed an off day. Three stars for the burrata only,
author: Karlynn J.

description:
Real Italian Pizza, with real Italian waiting times!!! 
Be prepared to wait 35-45 minutes, and forget reservations, you still have to wait, but it's well worth waiting!
author: Gianluca V.

description:
My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. The service could have been better, but luckily for them, the food was great, so I will still give it 4 stars and would go back. We had a reservation (weeks in advance) for 7:30 and we got there around 7:25, yet they didn't seat us until 8:00.) Then, it took about 20 more minutes for us to get the order for our drinks in and to get water.

Despite the delayed service, the food was great! We got an appetizer, bottle of wine and two entrees and shared it all. For the appetizer, we got the burrata. Y-U-M. Highly recommended. We got the sausage pizza which had a white sauce. They serve the pizza with scissors for you to cut yourself, which was kinda cool. It was the perfect combination. Finally, my boyfriend's favorite was the pork fettuccine. The noodles were so fresh, the pork was super tender, and it tasted amazing. The waitress helped us decide on a bottle of wine and we went with a full, Italian red wine that she said was similar to a cab, and her recommendation was great. We both loved it. Overall, we got way too much food - one pizza is probably more than enough for two people.

The ambiance was awesome as well, and the place was extremely crowded, so I'll give them a break on the service, and we will definitely be back.
author: Megan F.

description: We had lunch here, and even though the lunch menu is pretty limited, we enjoyed it very much.  The pizza was very good.  I especially liked the pie with the ricotta and artichokes in the handle.  We started with a mixed chicory salad which was excellent, and the 'wine by the glass' selection was varied. and interesting.  The only thing we did not think was stellar, was the apricot crostata.  We will definitely return.
author: Vicki T.

description:
Not surprised the overall review is 3.5 despite the food being pretty good.

The service is AWFUL.  Do they purposely find servers who are rude and don't like people?  This was the first time I tipped 10% in years just to tell our waitress we were not happy about waiting 15 minutes for water, no bread served, and another 15 minutes to order then had to look at the frown on her face all night.

Pizza - good, but go to delfina instead and get better service.  The pasta thats on the 7x7 "large" is $18 and should have been $7. WOW, overly priced.
author: Melody T.

description:
I dont understand the hype that this place gets.  The ambiance was nice but the positives end there.  My wife and I were in SF this past weekend and numerous locals had told us we must eat at A16.  The food was incredibly average.  We ordered the margherita pizza, which was bland and flavorless.  The bucatini was ok but nothing to write home about.  The squid ink pasta was just not good;  Im not sure why people on yelp were raving about that.

The service also sucked.  We waited about 20 minutes before someone came and took our drink order.  If you must go (and I dont recommend that you do), bring a bottle of wine.  Even with the $30 corkage fee, it wouldve been cheaper than the $75 we spent on 2 carafes of their most modestly priced wine.
author: Johnny M.

description:
Came here before the Tracey Morgan show without an RSVP.

Luckily we were seated immediately.

First we had the proscuitto tasting, salsiccia pizza, then the alaska halibut complimented with two sides of fingerling potatoes and roasted asparagus.

Dinner was pretty delicious. I enjoyed everything that was ordered, and wouldn't mind coming back again. Our service was great, and accommodating as we were only a tight schedule.
author: Ken C.

description: Service was lacking at lunch time on a weekend but the food was pretty good. I think you can't go wrong with the pizzas and the burrata was fresh. Good but not amazing food- a place I would probably go again had it not been for the lack of service.
author: Piper W.

description:
I have been to A16 in the past and it has been amazing!  However, at my last dinner here, I was totally "wine-shamed" by our server.  He totally gave us attitude for asking for help on the wine list  - we wanted to order two bottles - and shamed us for suggesting that we were looking for Chianti and Pinot Grigio ("They don't go that far north") and did not offer suggestions or help... It was really uncomfortable and went on far too long.  I'm not a wine pro, but it's not like we were asking for non-Italian varietals.  I have been to many nice restaurants and never treated this way.

It actually ruined what should have been a really nice evening.    I guess the James Beard nomination for best wine program went to their head (or at least our servers!)  Sadly, I will not be returning.
author: Leslie B.

description:
Foul.

Went for Valentine's Day. The "A16 11th Anniversary Dinner"

Service: D  (hopelessly lost servers, busboys ripping dishes away, only seated 20 min late which is fair for Valentines Day, 20 minutes to even order our prix fixe selections)

Food: D+    (trout was barely cooked, duck breast was way way overcooked, gnocci were weak, yellowtail crudo flavor was just brutal, burrata the only thing that was tasty)

Dessert: F-  (zuppa inglese...the owner would be shocked to see what we were served. HORRIBLE)

Both couples to our left and right were in full agreement on their equal displeasure.

Cost:  $268 with one reasonable bottle and tip.

Please please please do yourself and your woman a favor and avoid this overpriced spot next year.
author: Aldo A.

description:
I am torn between a 3 and 4 star review. I was really excited to try A 16 because it's always packed and so charming from the outside. I finally made a reservation well in advance for an anniversary dinner for my fiance and I. There were a couple great things about our dinner:
- Ambiance - It's really beautiful inside and out
- Wine list - We selected a great bottle of wine with the help of the somm (the Italian wine list is intimidating! but impressive)
- Appetizer - Burrata was excellent and my fav part of the meal

But unfortunately a few things are keeping me from giving a higher review:
- My entree - I ordered the pork chop and it was just disappointing. Very salty and fatty  and I didn't really enjoy it. 
- The sides - we had polenta and roasted cauliflower and both were lacking in flavor

I probably should have stuck with pizza or pasta, but I was really craving a meat entree. Unfortunately the food let me down so I'm giving 3 stars. I would give A 16 another try though, definitely.
author: Paige D.

description:
I had a great dining experience here and would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys rustic Italian food.

Polenta - a nice, rich recipe for something that is usually very plain and made it into something quite tasty

Cannellini Beans with Garlic and Oregano - another dish that was so simple, but so good...I think the trick was the perfect balance of the few flavors, which really was a great side dish/starter

Salsiccia Pizza - a really good pizza topped with savory sausage, onions, cheese, garlic and tomatoes.  I was actually surprised by how large the pizza was.  The flavors were great and tasted fresh.  I did not leave disappointed. 

This is a very popular spot with a  ton of people...I came here on a Tuesday night and it was packed...make sure you have a reservation!
author: Ken G.

description:
I've been here quite a few times but have not reviewed it yet. So, here we go.
I would say this is one of my top favorite places in the city.  I always enjoy my time here, whether coming for food or wine.  Just a good atmosphere to be in.  

So, last night we had:
-Buratta:(always excellent, so creamy and delightful)
- Octopus salad: (It was cooked really well.  Octopus can be chewy, but A16 cooked it perfectly.  Also, I  thoroughly enjoyed the ingredients they paired it with.  It all went really well together).
- Squid Ink Tonnarelli:  Good flavors. I enjoyed it.
- Berkshire Porchetta: OMG I LOVE YOU. 'nough said. We had a side of cannellini beans.  Went well together.

Also had some great Italian red wine with our meal..

Also had the almond cake. Okay, I must say.  I've had dessert here a few times.  I am not THAT crazy about them.  But the pana cotta is pretty good. I would give this place 5 stars if I liked the dessert more.
author: S G.

description:
Quello che un ristorante fantastico!

The lengthy Italian wine list, creative dishes and pairings...you simply cannot go wrong here!  The great thing about A16 is their dining versatility...perfect for a date night, a quick bite at the bar, family dinner, glass of wine & appetizer, etc.

The gnocchi is a favorite (the dish changes regularly, but I believe the pasta is made in-house).

Worth the wait ~ you won't be disappointed!
author: Sophia R.

description:
I had high expectations from A16 as a lot of people recommended this place. I am very disappointed and I don't think it deserves such good reviews. I have been once with my boyfriend. We couldn't hear ourselves. We had burrata which was not nicely presented. We had a margarita pizza that was really not awesome. I could have made the same at home. 
The second time I've been, I thought I would have a better experience than the first time.... it didn't happen. The restaurant is so loud, I mean, extremely loud, especially the room located at the back of the restaurant. The dishes are very simple. I had another pizza that was not fantastic, I tried one of my friends and hers was also disappointing. 
Overall, it's way overpriced and not exceptional.
author: Emilie A.

description: Ingredients were simple and fresh, good service, nice atmosphere. Very fresh pasta. I was not wow'd by the food but was happy with our meal.
author: Beer W.

description:
Mmm burrata... Would come back just for that but fortunately they had quite a few other great dishes :) 

I also loved the arugula salad, chicken meatballs, and bruschetta. 

The chicken meatballs were fantastic, the bruschetta was good but strange that it has no tomatoes, & the arugula salad was perfect! 

The service was pretty slow for a late Wednesday dinner. We weren't in a rush but it took too long for them to bring out the second half of the dishes - we ordered some antipasti to share and had them bring it out two at a time. 

But our waitress was friendly and helpful in helping us choose a nice red wine and she was also on top of making sure our wine glasses stayed full :) which is always nice! 

Will be back to try some pasta and pizza !
author: Shanna N.

description: Came here for the first time for a group lunch with my office. We had a set menu that worked very well. We sat in the back patio / room which is a great spot for larger parties (15-20). Menu highlights included the buratta appetizer, the thin pizzas and the pumpkin gnocchi (we went in November).
author: Alixe R.

description:
I'm sorry to say that I am not impressed.  The pizzas are fine, and the burrata with proscuitto is awesome, but of course they didn't have to create that. I must say that the service people, and their attention to detail is fabulous. They are attentive, pleasant, and gracious.  But the menu items are limited and not diverse enough for those of us who think of Italian food as more than organ meats and peculiar combinations.  I understand that A16 and SPQR are known for this unique style, but honestly, we don't need another Incanto. Pig head and trotters should be described in a more appealing way.
I don't think that Nate Appleman, (the original chef/owner ?) would be pleased with the menu either.
Sorry, the restaurant did not live up to the hype.
author: janice s.

description: It never ceases to amaze me how people continue to keep this place open. It's been awhile since I  was there but just as bad. Friends birthday dinner; pasta was not al dente, full on crunchy! Pork chop came out completely raw twice! Fish was not fresh. Pizzas are the only thing edible in this place and there are plenty of places to get good pizza. Service was ok but after you bring out a raw pork chop 2 times you kinda lose credibility.
author: Jax B.

description:
I was super excited to eat here!  I will say that if I didn't have a gift certificate I wouldn't have ventured in here on my own. 

The wait staff does an amazing job of making you feel comfortable and taken care of. The hostess.. not so much. I'm glad that the atmosphere warms up the further back you go.

Portions are on the smaller size but the presentation is nice. The food sounded delicious & it was. If you need to impress this is the place to go. Couples on a date night...not so much.
author: Tam T.

description:
I still don't understand why this place is so packed with people all of the time. 

The food is extremely overpriced for the quality and portions that you get, and all of the dining tables are positioned so close together that you'll feel like you're sharing your dinner with strangers practically sitting on your lap.

To add to that, the squid ink pasta dish gave me food poisoning. I called the restaurant the next day to inform them of my thrilling late night bathroom adventure, and I got a response of "what do you want me to do about it?" Hmmm... I don't know... Maybe you can pretend you care and give me an apology? Act like you want to make it up to me by having me come back? 

Needless to say, I won't be going back.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Great experience at A16 while visiting San Francisco; food, wine, service all top notch. 

Plan to visit a second time while visiting and ask for Iris, knowledgeable, friendly service.

Margharita pizza among the best we've had.
author: Brian H.

description: Was a really big let down for us, after the Ritz Carlton recommended it. We had made reservations and after we walked in l, the hostess was extremely rude. The food was awful. The calamari had little to no flavor, our clams had sand still on them and we're not cooked right and the cheese they raved about tasted just of pure salt. Only reason I gave them two stars only because our server was awesome. Have eaten all over Italy and it is far from authentic Italian food. Will never go back.
author: Isabella T.

description:
This was the second time I have been there. The first was 05 or 06 so it really felt like the first time being there.  We had a reservation at 530 and were quickly sat down. 

After looking at the menu for a few mins our server came over and told us about the specials and let us look over the menu and wine list for a few more mins. The wine list here is made up of mostly southern Italian wines and therefor you will not know any of them unless you really know wine. The wine guy came over and asked if he could assist me in picking out a wine. Of course I said yes! I wanted to try a Sicilian wine so he pointed out a few that were on the page I was looking at. The first bottle he suggested was $222, the second $195, and the third $185. He picked out the three most expensive bottles on the page. Any ass can do what he did! So I quickly sent that prick on his way and picked a more reasonably priced $65 bottle, that was very good. 

We then ordered  some food to share
the prosciutto sampler- wonderful BIG piles of two different types 
marg pizza- everyone says you have to try and it was just ok, but eating with the prosciutto and chili paste oil made it much more enjoyable 
pasta- wonderful texture, you can really tell it was house made, the sauce was a little acidic from the tomatoes for me

We each ordered our own entrees
she had the duck- really good flavor, faro was nice, sweetness from the pomegranate 
I went with the short rib- I'm sad to say it was the worst short rib I have ever had! The liquid it was braised in and served over was terrible. Its hard to describe because it started sweet and then finished with an almost bitter taste and was so over powering that I couldn't even taste the meet. I left well over half of it on the plate. Our server could tell there was something wrong and asked how I was doing. I said everything was good because I'm not big on sending things back to the kitchen. I know they are doing their best and it just wasn't for me.

Our server was great! I wish I could remember her name because she was one of the highlights of this place. She is the only reason I didnt give a 2 star rating 

I guess you have to know what to order here to have a good meal because some of the stuff is just not good.

One thing that bothered me and the restaurant has no control over this was the three guys sitting next to us. I was on a date and having a great time when these guys were sat right next to us. They were talking about work and one guy was so loud and obnoxious. Every word out of his mouth was fuck this, shit that, that fucking cunt, I tell that bitch how its done, that fucking cock couldn't do what I do ect ect ect.  It got to the point where is was awkward and uncomfortable to sit next to him.
author: Vince C.

description: Great pizza, great apps, great drinks.  A diamond in the Marina rough.
author: Phillip S.

description:
This place has gotten a bit too big for its britches.  Sometimes, the service is excellent, other times indifferent.  The people at the hostess desk are not welcoming. It appears they could care less.  My husband and I go to dinner at this restaurant about 6 times a year, and many times we bring a guest.  This brings me to my biggest gripe: the restaurant squeezes a party of three into a table for two.  I may be wrong, but the tables for two and three are exactly the same size.  Worse they seat parties of three right next to larger parties so one person in my party of three always gets bumped during the meal by a fellow diner at the next table. These seating arrangements do not make for an enjoyable meal.

The food is good, the menu is a bit limited and a pricey for what it is.  Given how often we dine here, I would expect someone at the hostess desk to recognize us and at least welcome us back. Perhaps the general manager thinks they have enough business without making every diner feel welcome.
author: Norwich Lover V.

description:
I can not recommend it! That was not a good food, and too expensive. The  "chocolate budino tart sea salt, extra virgin olive oil" was horrible, extremely salty mainly at the bottom.
And also notice that one of the girls that work there, was wearing  a very inappropriate  mini skirt, for a party, a night out with friends or for another kind of establishment its ok, otherwise looks really bad.  
Our experience was disappointing, and for sure we can not recommend it to anyone that love Italian food!
author: Sianya B.

description:
Dear Future A16 Guest:

I am no cheese connoisseur, but a very picky cheese eater. I hate most cheeses. However, order the burrata with olive oil, sea salt and crostini. It is a creamy version of mozzarella that melts in your mouth. The sea salt gives it extra flavoring for that excitement. I would actually come back just for the burrata. 

Sincerely, 
Picky cheese eater
author: Mabel Y.

description:
It was fine, but not memorable.  
We tried all the favorites mentioned on Yelp.  We started with the burrata which had a very rubbery texture and little flavor.  Then we had the margherita pizza + arugula and prosciutto, which was good.  Reminded me of a lesser version of Zero Zero.  And finally we tried the house made ricotta salad.  Just a warning, this is a heavy, filling dish.  If you are sharing a few dishes, I'd recommend getting a small just to get a taste.  We learned the hard way..we got the large, then had to pass on dessert.  
Also, I didn't appreciate having to wait for 15 minutes for a late mid-week dinner when we had a reservation AND they weren't even busy.  It makes me think their popularity is getting to their head.
Not planning on coming back...I'd rather try a new restaurant or go back to one of my favorites.
author: Gloria N.

description:
This place is good.

Order more appetizers and pizza instead of entrees and you'll be happy.
author: Mark J.

description: Pretty hard to beat the consistently great service, simple yet flavorful dishes, and warm atmosphere. Definitely walk or cab it here because parking spaces are as rare as winning lottery tickets.
author: Michael G.

description:
I had a fantastic dining experience here. The atmosphere, food and service were all top notch and our waiter was incredibly knowledgeable about the entirety of the menu and the wine list, and helped us to pick a bottle that complimented our meal. I have to say that the waiter is probably the reason that I am giving this a 5 star review, but it would have been close either way.

I appreciate that the pasta dishes are served in either the full entree size or a smaller portion so you can get a pasta item as well as an entree to have the full Italian dinner experience without getting too much food or overspending.

The starters and the pizzas dominate the menu, with a few pasta and entree choices. We started with the burrata, which was very good and ridiculously creamy. I think this is probably their top selling starter because the two tables next to us ordered it as well. Although I have heard amazing things about their pizza we decided to go the pasta route and got the Ricotta gnocchi with mushrooms and the Bucatini, which were both delicious. For my main course I had the pork chop and it was probably the best chop that I have had. If it is on the menu I would definitely recommend this.

Overall a fantastic and non-rushed dinner and they gave us a free dessert - score
author: Frank J.

description:
Came here on New Year's night for a quick meal before heading out to Sundance Kabuki to catch True Grit. Wait wasn't as long as we anticipated and was seated diagonally from the bar. Waitress was fairly nice and service was acceptable. Let's just put it this way, it was a busy night for them!

For appetizers:
-Burrata with olive oil, sea salt and crostini
-Prosciutto tasting: La Quercia Berkshire prosciutto and prosciutto di Parma

Our favorite was the prosciutto tasting. Nothing but mouthful of meaty and salty goodness!

For entrees:
-Salsiccia Pizza: fennel sausage, rapini, mozzarella, tomato, grana, garlic, onions, chiles, olive oil
-Aqua Pasta (not sure if that's the accurate name of the dish, but that's what I heard the waitress told us over the noisy background)
-Dungeness Crab Pasta
-Beef short ribs alla genovese

Top dishes of the night were the crab pasta and the salsiccia pizza. For the rest of the evening, I couldn't stop thinking about the crab pasta and regretting not ordering that dish instead of the "Aqua Pasta". 

Fun ambiance. Wouldn't really suggest taking a date here because it's rather noisy but coming here with a bunch of friends would be ideal!
author: Jenny K.

description: Incredibly disappointing condescending service last night by green hair waiter. We will not be back to this location. I ALWAYS tip 20%...I left $5 on a $139 bill if that gives you any indication.
author: Melissa M.

description: I was perusing yelp and saw that A16 has 3 1/2 stars. What??! I had to rebut. Read some of the reviews and I must say, these people cannot be trusted. A16 is one of my regular go to restaurants, for good reason. First of all, the food is always top notch. Not only delicious, but FRESH, seasonal, homemade ingredients. Sorry, it's not Pizza Hut! Never had problem with the service there. Beer and wine only, but the selection is great. It's expensive, but it's fine dining and worth every penny. If you want cheap and greasy pizza, go to Papa Johns or Little Caesars. That's what those places are for! Don't go to A16 and then bash one of my favorite places for being out of your league!
author: Jen J.

description:
Came here for a prix-fixe dinner with a large group, so my experience is a bit different than "normal", but the food was hands-down great.

What I loved:
Burrata - can't go wrong
Arugula salad - with roasted and pickled grapes!!?  soooo gooood.
House salumi - but mostly for the pickles (what is with me and pickles these days.  No, I am not pregnant)
Margherita pizza - DAMN.  One of the best I've had.
Maccaronara - awesome big pasta with lots of tomato-ey sauce
Chicken meatballs - so flavorful!  and no sauce needed!
Chocolate budino tart - OH YEAH.  Super chocolatey and salty and perfect.


Not so great:
Salsiccia pizza - meh. the rapini/greens flavor was a bit overpowering and the whole thing was a bit dry
Mushroom risotto - fine, but didn't blow me away
Steak - nothing special for me here
Chicories (salad) - somehow bitter and flavorless at the same time

Overall, I'd come back.  But instead of trekking to the Marina, I'll go to the A16 in Rockridge - less than 3 miles from my house! Win!
author: Laura B.

description:
I was actually very impressed by A16's food and wine. Not so impressed by the prices, which were the usual trendy Italian Deflina prices - approx $19 for a pretty small pizza.

Free bread - As per the menu, you must request complimentary bread to your table. You're not missing anything if you don't get it though.

Burrata Appetizer - GREAT burrata. Served on TERRIBLE toast. I almost broke a tooth eating it.

Pizza - Added an egg (for $2 - robbery!). Salsiccia was not bad but one minor comment is that I hate when people cut pizzas into squares (vs triangles) because it makes the spreading of 1 tiny egg that much more difficult. And several people end up eating crust only.

Pasta - I had the pasta with red sauce. Loved the texture of the fresh noodles, which was significantly better and tastier than Specchio's. 

Pork Shoulder Entree - was the first time I've ever had a pork shoulder that wasn't shredded and pulled. It was however very tasty and tender despite appearing like a pork chop of sorts.

Chocolate Torte - DELICIOUS. I'm always very skeptical of chocolate tortes which restaurants tend to make overly sweet and solid. I love rich chocolates, and A16 nailed it with their slightly salty, very rich but delicate mousse.

And finally I had a very affordable bottle of white that was DELICIOUS. So delicious that I am literally going to go online and buy myself a bottle of. YUM.
author: Jess C.

description:
One of my favorite pizzas of all time is the Funghi pizza. It is thin, has cute little mushrooms as one of the toppings (I'll leave fungi labels to the mycologist) and is baked in a wood-buring oven. The leftovers were just as great the next morning, I moaned a little ;D

Dinner atmosphere was lively and cozy. Peering at the fire of the open kitchen while sipping a glass of wine was a treat.
author: Sasha I.

description: We have had lunch at A16 twice and both meals were superb. A16 is very popular and, therefore, often very crowded. But, meals and service is worth the wait. Reservations are essential, but can usually get in if early for lunch. Great location in the Marina district. For lunch the pizzas and pastas are excellent, and an excellent wine list with well-informed servers.
author: Candance N.

description:
My homegirls and I tried making a reservation on Open Table for A16 on a Thursday night. Unfortunately, they did not have any openings, so we decided to take a chance and just walk in. We walked in and I asked for a table, and the host told us that it will probably be a 40 minute wait, and we decided to wait.... but it took much longer than 40 minute and the waiting area was really cramp and stuffy. 

We finally got seated and we all knew what we were going to order, since we were staring at the menu while waiting for a table. WHICH was a good thing, because we read EVERYTHING, and on the bottom it said that "bread is served when requested" or something like that. We would have starved to death waiting for our food if we did not have the bread. We had two bread basket while waiting for our food, cause a few of the girls were starving. The bread was okay.... it isn't warm like the bread you normally get at other restaurant, these were cold.

Anyways, three of us had the Maccaronara with ragu napoletana and house-made ricotta salata , since it was on that "100 things to try in SF" List. One girl got Bucatini with Sicilian almond and dried san marzano pesto, mint and pecorino, and another girl got the Marinara Pizza.

Out of all three of the food, I would say the pizza was the best and worth the money. The portion of the half size pasta plate was ridiculously small and it was $9.... I would say the portion was less than a pack of ramen noodle. The flavor of the pasta was good, but it wasn't anything special. The texture of the noodle reminded me of the type of noodle used in the Korean/Chinese black noodle, which I like. BUT The pizza was delicious. The dough was soft and the marinara was amazing. And that pizza was huge for $11.50. Lesson learned.... GET THE PIZZA, it tastes better and you can get full.

Now to Dessert. I ordered Chestnut and espresso torta with frangelico and caramelized hazelnuts. It reminded me a lot of tiramisu, and it was really soft and fluffy. It was really good. My other friend ordered the Poached pear and frangipane crostata with anise-brown sugar gelato, and that was pretty good too. It reminded me of pie. But one of the girl said she ate something in it that tasted like licorice.... weird.... I thought it tasted fine. 

Overall, this place is not too bad. But I will definitely just order the pizza next time.
author: Alicia W.

description: The food is good, but not amazing. My mozzarella salad was underdressed. The peppers should not even be on the menu. Way too hot and too many of them. The service at lunch time was super slow . Dinner time was better . They don't service alcohol outside just FYI . The pizza is delicious.
author: Irina A.

description:
I've been here twice recently.  The first time our meal was phenomenal.  We loved everything, especially the burrata appetizer and fungi pizza.  The second time, just this past weekend, we were disappointed.  The pastas (all 3 of them) were exceptionally bland and lacked any flavor.  I hope it was a rare fluke, but boy was our party let down.

Four stars because service was superb.
author: K V.

description: Good food, everything is good. We ordered burrata, neetle, and bunch of desserts, all the desserts are fine. But If you don't like soft pasta, don't order neetle it's to mushy. Also they have a good ambiance.
author: Ibnu A.

description:
11.02.10

I rushed home from work to grab my car.  I rushed to the polling place to vote.  Slapped on my sticker, rushed over to A16 to make the 7:00 reservation.  Ended up waiting for my friend for another good 15 minutes, but I digress.

The waitress brought me my glass of wine while I waited.  Before I start to think she is nice, my friend shows up and all attention goes to him.  It's like.I.don't.exist.  She tells him the specials.  She takes the order from him.  Never looking my way for the rest of the night.  Way to make me feel good, lady.  (But other than that, you did a good job.  You did bring me my beer, albeit tardy.)

We started with the prosciutto (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/e3WDNQMYpLdMEmM2UV13rA?select=xP2q82FVMNRGttwxeGqESA).  Time elapses, we catch up, and then our maccaronara (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/e3WDNQMYpLdMEmM2UV13rA?select=HglJQHSnCIeYFvy3ipAjjA) and salsiccia (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/e3WDNQMYpLdMEmM2UV13rA?select=FRdYMJRsahEIlzfOsy_Yyg) came.

All the dishes were excellent, and will make a great leftover dinner tonight.  It was so filling that we only finished half of the entrees...but maybe I was just too busy talking to eat.

Total damage: less than $85.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I've been kind of stingy lately with the five stars, but our experience last night was definitely above average ... and yes.  As good as it gets.

Parking in the Marina is always difficult, but this place is close enough to the Presidio that it makes some sense to park in one of the lots there and take a nice little stroll to dinner.  It's not far from the Lombard gate.

We arrived early for our reservation, received a friendly greeting, and were seated right on time.  The back room - what looks to be a converted patio - is slightly quieter than the main dining room, though beware of the slightly sloped floor near the drain.

Service was generally excellent - the servers knew the menu, knew the wine, had some good suggestions, and were generally available when we needed them.  A final glass of wine arrived somewhat tardily, and we did have to send back a salad that arrived dressed when we had requested undressed, but those are minor points, cheerfully and quickly rectified.

The restaurant specializes in the regional wines of Campagna - and a lack of familiarity on my part was no impediment.  A few words about what sort of flavors I like were all that was needed to produce three glasses of delicious grapey goodness.

The food was great.  Eschewing the main courses, we had the escarole salad ( generous, good flavor ), octopus ( wonderful texture, again stunning flavor ) and a small charcuterie plate ( four selections + spicy pickles, all good ).  

We had to have a pizza, and were steered toward the Pizza Romana - a spicy and savory selection.  It was big and bold.  Spicy flavors were especially prominent, with lots of garlic and olives accented by a few pieces of anchovy here and there.  The crust was deliciously chewy, and the pizza arrived barely cut on a grid.  Good stuff.

For pasta, we were steered away from the gnocchi and in the direction of the Maccaronara - a good choice.  Thick noodles with an excellent texture and a simple yet delicious sauce.  It's no wonder they're famous for that one.  We also had a squid ink fettucine with plentiful and delicate squid parts.  The pasta was dark and flavorful, with slightly more bite than we thought appropriate.

Dessert - a delicious and light panna cotta won over even this panna cotta questioning diner.  The seasonal pear upside down cake was disappointingly dry, but nicely crusted with strong pear flavors.

We had a good time.  It's a loud restaurant - not the place for a romantic date - and it can be crowded and hard to park in the area.  But they're definitely doing it all right here.
author: Albert H.

description:
Delicious food and great customer service. Yes, it's a bit pricey but a nice place for a birthday gathering or a small celebration.

Big plus for the customer service. Our waiter was supposed to box up some pizza for us, but it got misplaced or someone grabbed it on accident. What did they do? Made us another pizza to take with us! WHEEE!!
author: Stella H.

description:
Unlike most places in the city, the food actually got better as the courses progressed. And for that reason, I am going to do my review backwards as well. :)

The poached pear and frangipane crostata (with a candle for my bday) was fantastic. I did want the 12-year Tawny port though.
