Of course the place was jammed, so they will, for the time being, get away with sub-par cooking, bad manners, and a my-shit-doesn't-stink attitude. Two hours I will NEVER get back, thank you very much.
author: John F.

description: What a disaster!  I had been to A16 before and had a so-so time with each visit--but I went there to celebrate a birthday this weekend and IT WAS TERRIBLE.  The staff--with the exception of the general manager, who was quite polite and horrified when we exited by handing her our comments about the evening so she would be sure to know how we felt--was extremely unengaged and unfriendly.  Too bad they did not know that they were serving a television producer of a morning show out scouting San Francisco restaurants and an attorney who sits on three boards in town!  They couldn't be bothered.  Bad table, bad attitude, tons of noise in the back room (which sounded like an echo chamber) and the food was overwrought and--sorry--not good.  My "special sausage" was dry and too spicy--Bruce Aidells makes a better sausage for a lot less money!  It was too-too-too...thus leaving us feeling like we should have gone to HOLY GRILL for a burger instead and saved the $600.00.  What a waste.  I will NEVER GO TO A16 again and i strongly urge you all not to fall prey to the press on this place.  It is not good, believe me--save yourself the money and go somewhere where you can hear your dinner companions, the staff is welcoming, and the food is inspired and tasty.  That is not A16.
author: sheila s.

description: Some of my friends who eat out often were recommending me to try out A16. I also heard it was one of the top ten or top hundred restaurants in the bay area. I love food especially Italian and French cuisine. This is the first time I have written a review on a restaurant because I can't take all the bad food out there and I need to vent. My wife went in first to get a table and this night there were plenty of tables but the hostess took her back to the counter area and didn't ask if she wanted a table or not. We changed to a table in the addition area with lots of heat come down. Our waitress for the night was very nice. The first item we had was sardines which was less than average. The next course we had was the famous meatballs and a dish of gnocci. The meatball was bad and didn't taste like there was much meat in there. The gnocci was ok and nothing to rave about. The entrees we had were the beef braciole which was good, but the worst dish was the petrale sole with pistachio and other spice I forgot. The flavor was so bad it ruined the sole completely. Don't people taste their recipes before they put it on the menu. We were so bumed out that we didn't even try dessert. I go out and pay good money for good food and I have been disappointed so many times that it's hard for us to try new places. These days people listen to critics like the pipe piper. WAKE UP and smell the food!
author: chris n.

description: round one at a16, sometime last year, was a clear victory for delfina. i found the food forgettable, the service rushed, and the noise level exceptionally high. i went back last night for round two and a16 put up better fight. our service was excellent, the pizza top shelf, and the noise level moderate. well done a16.
author: Stephen D.

description: This place sure is hard to get a reservation for.  I finally got one on a Thrus at 10pm and went with a friend of mine after a wine tasting event.  We ordered a carafe of red wine, a san giovese, syrah, barolo blend that was quite interesting.  In fact they have a lot of unique wines on their ine list.  For dinner we shared squid ink pasta with calamari and lamb crespelle with a side of romano beans with anchovies and lemon.  The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente with a good dose of garlic and a nice amount of calamari.  The crespelle were delicious and very flavorful.  The only thing i did not like were the beans which were mushy and a bit too fishy. This place has a good atmosphere and ambience including a nice patio. The food is traditional and authentic italian but instead of run of the mill dishes the items on the menu are unique &  well executed.  I look forward to going back again sometime
author: Melanie -.

description: So, just returned for the second time and had snacks/dinner here tonight.  I've never actually looked at the yelp reviews for this place until just now....wow, I'm surprised how many bad reviews there are!  Especially surprised at all of the reverse snobs out there!  So what if it's a yuppie place--get the fuck over it and eat!  Anyways, that said, my meal/wine/service were excellent.  We didn't have a reservation, so actually used our intelligence, got there early (around 5:45), and sat at the bar.  The bartender and barback were both nice and attentive--we never had to wait long for anything, despite the fact that it was a very busy Sat. night.  I was unfamiliar with almost all of the wines, but the bartender made some excellent suggestions, and was also extremely generous with pouring tastes to try!  The fennel sausage pizza was excellent and crispy, with some lovely charred bits, and not at all greasy.  The maccaronara pasta was perfectly al dente...and the hazelnut semifreddo outstanding (although, and I don't want to admit it, my boyfriend's chocolate budino enhanced with a little olive oil and sea salt was just a little better).  The bartender was also very generous with the dessert wines....how could I possibly leave unhappy?  While there, we decided that the bar was definitely the place to be--such good people watching and eavesdropping opportunities, and once the Marina snobs get a little toasted on all the booze, they are actually pretty human!  Will definitely go back ASAP!
author: colette m.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I can't bring myself to give it 5 stars as the waitstaff is spotty at times.  And not their fault usually, it just seems like they always have too many tables to take care of, but once you do finally get their attention they are great!  I also think the sommelier and bartenders are fantastic, especially with my lack of knowlege on Italian wines.  They always seem to come up with the perfect choice.  Now...for the food.  I'd go for the pizza and pasta hands down.  The macaronara is to die for and the gnocchi's are amazing.  I love that they have seasonal sides and appetizers.  I still dream of a whole roasted fava bean special they have in the spring.  This is my go to place with out of towners since the atmosphere is really nice, but not overwhelmingly so.  It still seems to hold on to a certain casual, neighborhood restaurant feel.  And I know, the wait is long, but grab a glass of wine from the great bartenders (who recognize you if you go often!) and relax.  It's worth it and it always seems like they're faster than the time they give.
author: L P.
